sequence: The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once, about ten years ago. I remember I liked the book a lot, and this movie does a good job in telling the story. The most important thing in this movie isn't the story, however, but the highly original visual look it has.The visuals are absolutely beautiful, and they are apparently achieved by a clever combination of animated drawings combined with live actors, stop-motion animation and sets that are painted so that they look much like from an animated movie.

I've commented once on this Chucky great, but I had to do it again to say some things about the film, when I first saw it in a great balcony in a great theater. The film was a lot of fun in the theater and my first Chucky film ever in a theater, and that was a special moment for me, because I cherish Chucky. The other horror villains are referenced with GREAT COOLNESS!!! And the gore was shockingly great! The scene where the gay kid gets nailed by the truck was amazingly cheerful!

This new installment to the Child 's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as this and this." "The Child 's Play movie is coming to an end and it seems to me that it is a very successful film." "So, let us get ready for the next movie in the series." "But, before that, before I introduce the Child 's Play movie, the first trailer of the Child 's Play movie." "But, the film is coming to an end soon and now, let us get back on to the other film."

Jeff Garlin 's film is filled with heart and laughter . As in Curb Your Enthusiasm , his screen persona is a sharp-witted, quick-witted, no-nonsense reporter with an eye for comedy. He was born and raised in Boston, and moved to New York City when he was 21. After several years of odd jobs and odd jobs, Garlin got a job as a reporter for The Boston Globe, where he went on to become one of the leading sports-writers in the paper's history. The film, which is set to star Will Ferrell as his character, is based on a real life story of Garin's.

No, I have not seen the original series and I won't compare the two if I had. This series is filmed in Canada in Vancouver and Victoria, British Columbia. The series is well-written in a different story each week. Some are little out there but most of the time it is the quality of the story telling. I loved the Afterlife episode with Clancy Brown and Barbara Gerrick and the Deprogrammers episode with the irresistible Brent Spiner as a Deprogrammer in a world where humans have become slaves to a lizard reptilian species.

This film , winning Im Kwon-Taek the Best Director at Cannes in 2002 ( tied with P.T . Anderson for his first-ever film nomination in that category ) , is a searing portrait of the Korean American immigrant community’s struggle to maintain their identity in this new country. The film is also an honest examination of the immigrant experience and the struggles that come with it, and of how the people of Korean descent are coping with the realities of living in the US. But that is not why this film takes us by surprise; it is also because of the performances of the two actors in the lead roles.

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character, unable to speak, living in a world incompatible with modern life. He trusts to his homemade weaponry - helmet, sleeves, and spear - made out of hubcaps, seat cushions, and discarded office furniture. Just as Don Quixote rode Rocicante, "The Man" rides his contraption (literally) transcending the lost lives caught up the harsh and demeaning modern world - soaring above the earth, away from the plight of modern man. Both characters ride in search of adventure in an effort to right the wrongs of the world.

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard (Beau Travail), Golden Door is a visually striking tone poem that follows the journey of a peasant family from their primitive home in Sicily to Ellis Island in New York at the turn of the century. It is a surreal, enigmatic, often strange, but ultimately deeply rewarding experience. Interweaving dreamlike and symbolic imagery with gritty realism, the latest film by Emanuele Crialese (Respiro) is like an impressionistic painting - a cinematic artist's rendering of what the immigration process may have been like for our parents and grandparents.

A labor of love. Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you. Then the sheer emotion and story-telling take you through a dream that stays with you long after the movie. The director gets your heart and leads it through 100 minutes of visual poetry. You are a part of the emotional ride of the characters. I have seen this movie at 2 festivals and it got with standing ovations at every showing. The remarkable story-telling transcends nationality and language and I felt I was a part of the drama unfolding before me. The casting is as perfect as one can get.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White , Cinderella , or Bambi , but it IS a very beautiful animated film

I saw this movie in the theatre when I was 12 years old . I remember being really impressed with this movie . At the time , I knew nothing about animation or film . My only knowledge was that my mother used to do home movies for the radio and would take a lot of footage from our family's vacations. I was very much into the horror genre , which had not yet begun to gain a lot of mainstream attention in my home country .

After seeing The Aristocats : Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound , I decided to see the full film. Well, what a surprise. As much fun as I remember this from the theater years ago, my expectations were met. Not only do I believe that The Aristocats (which I had never seen on television but was on VHS) will become one of my all-time-favorites, but I was amazed by how much fun they are. It's not a big musical, but it isn't a silent movie either.

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in America in the 1950s. It shows how racial tensions were brought to an extreme point by the Kennedy administration. We all know about that but there was more to this story. The film takes place during the year 1960 and shows many different characters and their thoughts about the black issue in America. One of those characters is Sam Adams, who was president of the National Urban League. He was a passionate believer in the civil rights movement when it began.

I know this movie is n't for everyone , and I wo n't push my opinions on you , but I will try . It is a dark film , and I wo n't recommend you see it for nothing but the story line . I have not read this book and my opinion on this book is not based on reviews from other sites . I'll admit that I haven't seen it yet, but I was curious to read about it and since it's just come out on the big screen I decided to pick it up so I could read some of it myself.

NOBODY ( 1999 ) is a fantastic piece of Japanese noir . It 's about three salarymen who get in over their heads with a couple of women. And they don 't even know they 're in trouble . Nobody is safe . The movie is directed by the Japanese filmmaker Kiyoshi Kurosawa . He's had some big hits with movies like Seven Samurai , Kagemusha , Ringu , and Yojimbo . The film was his first film after he came back from his years in the U.S . military . He was a decorated soldier during the Second World War .

This is my favourite Columbo. Martin Landau (excellent!) plays twins, one of whom may have committed a murder. This Columbo is unusual because the usual murder scene at the beginning doesn't give you any clue to which one did it! Peter Falk is on form as usual in this episode written by Steven Bochco (who also wrote 'Murder by the Book', my second favourite episode). The supporting cast are great especially Julie Newmar (very under-rated) and Jeanette Nolan as the house keeper that Columbo just keeps on upsetting.

I love this movie a lot. I must get this on DVD. I have 2 VHS copies, but the quality is so poor that you can't read one written joke over the door of the ward. I'm forever amazed that Blankfield did almost nothing afterward. He made both Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Hyde totally believable.The movie is plagued by it's low budget. (One atrocious edit jumps into mid-word and was described on, "Siskel & Ebert".) But, there are a thousand jokes, sight gags to subtle references, that more than compensate.

When I saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy American movie done on the cheap with appalling actors. I was really surprised to find that i was totally wrong. The movie centres around Bartely or B who has been rejected from all of his colleges- the actor who play B is very natural and makes his character seem real- and decides to create a pretend school so his parents stop harassing him. However loads of people see his fake website and join. Feeling their sorrows B can't turn them away much to the chagrin of his best mate.

It was a terrific movie ! I like to watch it again and again . The actors were awesome . And the music was superb ! I have no words to explain how i feel about it . I love to see this movie with my wife and kids . I think its a wonderful movie . It was a great experience watching this movie again and again. I would like to wish this movie to every Indian , because i am sure that this movie has made the Indian country proud. It's the first Indian movie i ever saw.

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell of his days as a soldier. He has to find a way back home so he goes to the past. This game is amazing and I am enjoying it. I can see the story growing, and there are many different ways to play this. You can be a soldier, you can have a friend to go along for the ride, or you could even play the entire game all by yourself! I also think the music is amazing, and the sound effects are also pretty good.

My friends and went through a period of time when we would rent movies that none of us had ever heard of. The only good that came from it was this movie, "Take it to Limit" Right as the movie started, we could tell we were in for a true classic. The music is probably done by rural white boys from Colorado, but it sounds just like early 90's rap. The star of the show, actor Leo Fitzpatrick, plays the bad-boy so well, especially sporting a big zit the entire movie.

A well written screenplay. A moving story showing the middle class English at it's best. Some great acting by Tom Wilkinson and Emily Watson. Tom Wilkinson is one of Britain's best actors. He knows how to be subtle and honest. Emily Watson is an actress I was not familiar with, but to her credit she does a great job of playing the ****** wife. The director, Julian Fellowes did not succumb to the typical Hollywood gimmicks to give the film some meaty storyline. It has not over dramatized it's portrayal of the English middle class.

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old , I adore AristoCats . It is my passion and my life. I love my kids and my hubby and my hubby and I love our kids. So it is about this month that my son has decided he is ready for a new, bigger and better house. Well, not sure what he thinks of this but we have been talking about it for the past 2 years. We have been talking a lot about this house as of late.

If you haven't seen this film, do it. Its a genremix as i've never seen another. Some very surreal scenes, some hilarious funny stuff, a film noir felling, musical numbers with a swing, sex scenes (The 2nd best played orgasm on Film, bested only by Sally), a pitch of Orson Welles blended together into a work of art. As an work of art it hasn't to be logical at the end, at least not logical for everybody ;-). I owned an tv copy on VHS but loaned it to an ex-girlfriend and now i can't get it back.

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character , unable to speak , living in a world incompatible with modern life. In order to communicate with the world Jolivet adopts an imaginary speech that he makes up in his imagination to make sense of his situation. To make it real to himself, to make sense of himself and his surroundings he makes up a speech of his own, and a speech for others who are interested. He creates his own language, and uses that language to communicate with himself, with the world around him and with people interested.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film, The Life of Jimmy Dolan which starred Douglas Fairbanks, Jr. as the prizefighter on the lam.Even with the restrictions now upon production by the Hays Office, this remake actually turns out to be better than the original. Douglas Fairbanks, Jr., is horribly miscast as a pugilist. John Garfield with his background and style steps into a part he was born to play.They Made Me a Criminal was directed by Busby Berkeley who Jack Warner believed in keeping busy in between musicals. Berkeley in fact would soon be leaving Warner Brothers for MGM.

`` D.O.A '' is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish . Dennis Quaid is at his most charming and wily in the first half hour . Quaid spends most of this opening half trying to prove to himself and others that he is a capable reporter ( '' I'm smart enough to know I can't be the guy''). However, at one point, Quaid admits to himself '' I'm not smart enough to be in this business.'' And, by that point, it's almost been revealed that he's about to be arrested by his own agency.

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good. And of course by that I mean Wilkinson. The other two principals were "decent". But the characters themselves...what on earth was so bad about the character Wilkinson played (James Manning)? I didn't see him behaving like the martinet Emily Watson accused him of being. Bill Bule, on the other hand, was an insufferable jerk who I was praying would meet an extremely brutal and prolonged demise. Who was I kidding? Tom Wilkinson isn't Paul Bettany after all.

The movie has taken a little flack for playing fast and loose with the facts. But it will put you close to being in a time and place that no longer exist by getting to the *feeling*.As Keith Richards remarks in Paul McCartney's movie about Holly, there's some Buddy Holly in almost all rock made since his day. The tragedy that took him is dealt with gently, and the rest of the movie recreates the joy of a great music career and a joyful body of music.Gary Busey does a remarkable, energetic portrayal of Holly, and his performances hint that he really gets into the music.

Blind Spot's images are great. The action draws you in completely, even though the movie is a bit long. By the end credits all that you can think about are the film's positive high-points. The lead actors have the most incredible screen presence. The story is heart-wrenching. The film score is nicely understated . Completely moving in its own powerful way. Not your standard melodramatic cuing. Trance-like moments add poetic resonance to the engrossing narration and terrific visual compositions. Hope you get a chance to see this film. It delves into some dark territory but you come out of the tunnel seeing nothing but white light.

Who ARE the people that star in this thing? Never heard of them!! But this is one of the funniest comedies I have run across. It should win the Putz Puller Prize for Parody. The absurd starts with Dr. Jeykl snorting his powder and turning into a sex fiend.He is pursued by libido driven nurse early in the movie in one of the funniest scenes of the movie. Pay attention to the hospital PA system in the background; rather like the system in MASH. The final scene with Hyde accepting the award has had me laughing for years.

The Aristorcats is a hilarious film that not many people have seen. Clearly not that many because it only got a 6.8. There is nothing wrong with it at all. It's my favorite of the Disney classics, which have tons of fantastic films already made. Like Beauty and the Beast, Snow White, and Peter Pan. The reason why The Aristorcats is so high on my list is because of how funny the film is. I hate to say this, but I don't blame Edgar for what he does. I probably would've had them taken care of too.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a football game or they don't want to leave their car "to get stripped" deserves whatever happens to them.The guy, Wade who "went to a barbershop and asked for the He-Man haircut" wasn't my type, but there's this really cute scene of him having his eyebrows and facial hair waxed. That's a little too high-maintenance for me. Also fun, but not my type is the fat guy in the big sunglasses who looks "like Elton John only gayer," but that whole plot goes nowhere!

My husband and I watched this last night...It was wonderful....For once he was wrong in guessing ahead of time the suspenseful ending. It moved along very quickly and the acting was superb.. I adore Tom Wilkinson anyway. He has never made a bad movie as far as I'm concerned. The above description of his acting hits the nail on the head... The facial expressions are incredible. Even the picturesque scenery is awesome. We have just finished watched all of the Prime Suspect series and I am convinced that the British have a way of capturing the audience.

SHOWTIME is a mess, but it's an entertaining mess. The plot is forgettable, the satire is lightweight and the action sequences, though well-staged, aren't that exciting. But I laughed. A lot. Credit goes to the inspired pairing of De Niro and Murphy. They have great chemistry. Murphy delivers the one-liners, De Niro cracks us up with a look or grimace. This movie will get a RUSH HOUR-like reception from the critics. Don't listen to them. If you're a fan of De Niro or Murphy, you're going to enjoy this movie.

Always enjoyed "DOA",1950,which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film. Dennis Quaid,(Dexter Cornell), was a professor who loved his wife and finally found out she was having an affair with one of his students. Dexter gets involved with Meg Ryan(Sydney Fuller), who was a student in his college class and at the same time had a big crush on him and wound up having a one night stand and in some ways loved him deeply. Dexter learns that he received a drink which had bad contents and would cause him a great deal of health problems!

No real plot , no character development , no Scorcese-level direction , but seriously , were you really expecting any of the above? And it's been ten years. It's probably time to put this episode behind you too. I don't know if I ever saw this show in any of its original format, I just saw it on DVD. It looked and felt more like a late night infomercial that had been converted to a show than anything else. There's a scene towards the beginning of the episode, where the two girls are talking about how much they hate their lives.

Mark Blankfield ( from the old late night TV show `` Fridays '' ) plays Dr. Daniel Jekyll , a brilliant man who is in his late 60s and suffers from Alzheimer's disease . He is the perfect man in every way except for one: he does not have a family . Jekyll suffers from Alzheimer's disease, which is very common and causes severe mental deterioration. After a series of events he is forced out into the real world and discovers that he is one of the most brilliant men on the planet. He is the only man in the universe who can bring peace to the earth.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year . You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime or on the Discovery Channel. I think the general public needs to be educated a little bit about true-crime movies so we know what we’re dealing with when we come to see one of these. There are lots of movies about murders, rapes, child abuse, or other crimes that people don’t like because they don’t want to believe the victims were victimized. There are even movies about sex crimes. I want the public to be aware of what the movies are really about.

I really enjoyed this film , it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat . It was very well done, and I couldn't get into the film . The plot was very predictable , and I didn't think the acting was good enough . I was expecting more than I got , so maybe it was just me . I think you could have cut the story down even more, and still had something with enough suspense and thrills that the ending was good , but that would still have been a disappointing film .

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply . I 've been looking at the case and I am very concerned. I am not sure I understand what is going on here. They are saying that the person who made the reproduction, made the copies themselves and they are suing the people who are distributing them . You have got to ask yourself what kind of business is it to produce something and then go and sell it? Or is it different to produce something for others and then sell it too?

This new installment to the Child's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as a stoner witnessing Chucky giveing him the finger and saying "rude f--king doll" and lots of references to the series: "you can kill me but I'll come back. I always come back". The movie's title was probably thought of before the script and was written around it. This is totally different from all other films in the series. It doesn't even have Andy, the central character for all the previous ones.

This movie is beautiful in all ways . It is visually stunning , and this is a good thing since there is not much to be said about the visuals and the acting . It is the story of three young girls . They all have secrets that only each one will tell . Some secrets are hard to share with the people they love and trust the most , while others they will never tell anyone , and then there are those secrets that are even harder to tell and that is why all of them are in the movie .

Without going into any details of a good...if a somewhat provocative...TV movie, there seems to be a consensus among the users that there is "no one to blame here".I disagree. Yes, the young male lover of Beverly D'Angelo, played by Rob Estes may be young and horny (and good looking) because he's not getting as much as he wants from mom, that doesn't mean, he can climb in bed and have sex with daughter. OK, he can use the excuse he just wanted to watch TV with her, but I don't buy it.

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918 . In fact , there is a lot less film to begin with , and there are only two of the three parts . I am sure the film would have worked better with the whole thing , but that is not the point . I am writing this for the sake of nostalgia , and not because you will enjoy the film better. I have not had the occasion to see the 1917 version of the film . It looks very good , even if you compare it with the 1919 silent version .

Well, I guess I was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning. This movie wasn't it. It plodded along at a pretty slow, deliberate pace for the first 40 minutes, but there wasn't really anything in it that I was terribly interested in--there's an intriguing and mysterious feud between Jean Reno's character and an old man, but more of the first 40 minutes is dominated by the wanderings of the main character, whom I didn't know much about and couldn't really relate to at the time.

*Could contain spoilers, read only after seeing last episode season 2* Think about it. The guys on the north pole? Center of the earth? Looking for abnormal magnetic behavior? They also said something about: "did we miss it again?" So there was another abnormality? Of course that was when the plain crashed! I think this whole Island is a setup. Set up by her daddy. She found out about it and is looking for her Desmond. How else can she know what to look for.So basically it's an Island in a magnetic shield.

This film, like much of their music, is either underrated or unnoticed by the casual observer. It is terrific and, in many ways, ahead of its time.The images are funny, disturbing, and at the very least, engaging. The music is amazing. This is not the "candy pop" sound they are unfortunately associated with. This is the sound of a band in exploration and revolt.HEAD, alone, should put The Monkees into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Can anyone tell me why these guys are not in there?

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO, regardless of the age of the OAV. The plot itself makes sense, but the characters don't.This might sound picky, but considering that the city of Olympus is almost exclusively populated by living machines, would YOU feel comfortable there as a human? Would any machine ever emulate human arrogance, short-sightedness and greed quite so effectively? I doubt it. There are some pointers towards this in the movie, but only when the team can be bothered to put them in, by and large the 'bioroids' (or whatever they are) are interchangeable with human characters.

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency. Putney Swope is on the board for no other reason than the fact that he is black, and the agency needs a "token" on the board. Swope is ignoring the meeting, reading Jet magazine at the big table, and everybody is ignoring Swope... Suddenly, the CEO croaks on the spot. No time is wasted. A janitor is called to haul off the corpse, and the board immediately and unceremoniously tackles the business of electing a new CEO.

I thought it was brilliant! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down. Dwight Schultz still looked the same, he had hardly changed in looks, neither had Dirk Benedict, he still looked just as dishy! I thought that Mr T looked thinner though, but it was still great to see how he looked after all this time. I thought that it took some doing tracking down the other members of the cast, such as the one who played Decker, and the lady who played Amy. It was just a shame that Mr T could'nt make the actual reunion.

My husband and I watched this last night ... It was wonderful .... For once he was wrong in guessing about the movie. He said it is just a simple film but it has so many things in it. We have watched it several times now and enjoyed it tremendously. I watched this last night on TV. I think it could have been a good movie if the movie makers had not made it so "simple". It took away from the main point. You would not be able to get away with that if it was not for the great music and the story.

This is probably my favourite TV show ever. I love all the characters, especially Alex, who is the PERFECT woman! Always makes me laugh and feel good when I watch this show. There is just something about it that is amazing, hard to describe.It seems some or all of the episodes synchronise with music albums as well. Here are a few examples. (The episodes start again when they end - but DON'T play end credits until the very end, but always play the opening credits. With most the episodes the album plays once and the episodes play twice, but some go on further.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film , like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles , as just another " gangster picture " or " gangster flick." I have been guilty of this myself, and I must confess this one was one of my favorite movies of the past year. There is very little about the movie that will shock you, and it does not seem like a typical gangster film. I would argue that the movie is more in tune with the real gangster world than many of the " gangster films " that followed.

This movie is truly a classic 80s movie! A must have in any '80s' movie collection! Guns, Bad Guys, CREEPS, Gangs, CHARLES BRONSON and more CREEPS!!!! In my opinion, this is the best Death Wish movie. Tons of non-stop action! And keeping with the classic 80's "bad guy vs good guy" movie - this movie is about anything but the norm and all about guns and CREEPS! We see Bronson mowing down thugs and CREEPS with a 30 caliber Korean War heavy machine gun! A HEAVY MACHINE GUN FOR CRYING OUT LOUD!

Always enjoyed `` DOA '' ,1950 , which starred Edmond O'Brien and was very curious about this film . Dennis Hopper had a great lead and the film was filmed very well with great production values. I really enjoyed watching and I wish I could revisit this film and see it again. I think this film had some great themes and it was one that had great acting and a story to tell . A great film, one of the most memorable of Dennis Hopper's entire career. Not the least remarkable of its charms was the great acting from O'Brien.

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne's "For The Flag" by the Czech master director Karel Zeman.Although the story is enacted in a rather understated late Victorian style, the visuals are a knockout. Zeman uses animation, graphics, painted sets, model animation combined with live action to create the atmosphere of Verne that the reader associates in his mind. The style resembles the steel engravings of Dore and Bennet and Riou that illustrated these stories with a healthy dose of Georges Melies added.Photographed in beautiful black and white the animation is of the highest order and not of a Saturday morning variety.

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house . this movie really has me in stitches from the very beginning. I love how the movie brings back so many classic horror stories. I think the reason this movie works so well is because we all know about a young boy that goes missing in the woods somewhere. we all know that this boy is going to be haunted by spirits and that he will not come back from his walk. this is where the movie really makes its mark.

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love, passion, and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss in his latest film BLINDSPOT.BLINDSPOT'S diegetic world is exploding with suspense and takes the audience on a twisting  journey to the core of the human soul. As a director, he manages to draw the human spirit from the performances of his actors. With superb editing, especially in the flashback scenes and beautiful cinematography, BLINDSPOT is a thought provoking suspense from beginning to end. A thriller which leaves much to the minds' eye.What an  astounding accomplishment for Stephan Woloszczuk. Cheers Stephan!

To say the truth, I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor. Folks may not agree, but he makes equally good performances in bad and good movies. I haven't seen a movie with Penelope Crus before, so I was anxious to see whether she is a good actress. So, here's what I think:The movie is good (I haven't read the novel, however). Some moments were really thrilling and... unexpected. Altogether you'll find the plot pretty simple.

Separate LIES changed my life. Actually, the Q&A did.SPOILERS BELOW. Read only if you watch trailers or if you've already seen it:The Emily Watson character cheats on the Tom Wilkonson character. My first reaction to the puppy-dog-eyed Emily was "It's Over. Dump her. Bad riddance." For some reason, he stuck around. Not in a pathetic way. He just listened. And tried to accept her needs. At times he needed to leave. But he stuck by her and let her live her life.

No real plot, no character development, no Scorcese-level direction, but seriously, were you really expecting any of this? The only thing that matters is that this flick is absolutely hilarious, nearly on the same level as Borat. Sure, the ending drags a bit, but if Borat's cameo didn't crack you up, you must be the worst batty boy in the history of batty boys. Sacha Baron Cohen is possibly the greatest comedian ALIVE, and here he gets more laughs than Jude Law on a nude beach.

**1/2 Elisha Cuthbert, Chad Michael Murray, Brian Van Holt, Paris Hilton and Jon Abrahams. Directed by Jaume Collet-Serra.Yet another classic horror film remade with dunder-headed teenage acting despite grizzly and creative deaths. Based on the 1953 Vincent Price film House of Wax where a maniac kills unsuspecting teenage hooligans and turns them into priceless wax figures. Still with the fantastic set design to make the whole house into wax the movie is a typical classic horror remake like Tobe Hooper's 1974 classic Texas Chainsaw Massacre later remade, despite creativity and so-so acting the movie was still just a gore picture.

I loved this film!! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it. I saw it opening night and loved it, Some people told me that this film wasn't any good and to stay away but I thought it was great. The actors did great and it was scary and made me jump. Paris Hilton did a great job for her first film, everybody is giving her a hard time when she did great and she didn't even have that big of a role. The set was great has it was made of all wax and how it was made.

You know, people who make comedies so often forget it's really ok to be outrageous. Well, not this time. Unconditional Love has it all. Barry Manilow and a dwarf in a movie with Cathy Bates as the romantic lead...and it works. Not only does it work, it works very very well. In fact, I think it's perfect. I laughed so hard I think I hurt myself yet the main characters were all so human, so honest, and so very real. But isn't that where great comedies come from?

I thought that the storyline came into place very well. I liked this movie a lot. If you're going to rag on a Bridget Fonda movie, you can just rot. I thought that ragging on movie stars was a bad idea. Apparently somebody doesn't think so. I rather enjoyed the movie. I'm even thinking of buying it. I want it to be my very first DVD for my room. That's how much I like it. I rather would not start an online argument with someone I don't know & have it be over a movie.

At one time ` Buddy Cop ' movies ruled the box office . It seemed that every summer flocks of youngsters would flood into town to experience one of the many adventures of one-eyed lawman and cop, a hero who would do things that only a good American could accomplish. And in every movie there would always be at least one character whose name would be changed from the previous year. For example: The year's title character would be a man named John, instead of a woman named Joan. Also: The hero would be a man with one eye, instead of a woman with five eyes .

In Nordestina , a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco , Antônio ( Gustavo Falcão ) is the owner of the local tavern . He is the one that runs the tavern for over twenty years . He lives alone in a house with a view of the town square . One morning he wakes up in a cold sweat when he discovers that the woman that he is in love with is now with someone else . Soon after , she is pregnant . After that , she tells him that he will be a father . He goes on a mission to look for the woman , but he finds no one .

When I saw this movie i expected it to be a cheesy American movie done on the cheap with appalling acting and bad dialogue. But it didn’t disappoint me as much as the movie was to me. I had a lot of fun. The main character, Sam, works as a security guard. He’s pretty much stuck at work all the time because the boss is too busy. And he really loves his girlfriend who is also a security guard. He gets a call from the boss telling him he has to go home.

Coming from the "druggie" generation, I thought this movie was hilarious. It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde up-to-date, so to speak. My husband and I laughed all the way through it. Would love to have the movie in my collection. I told my two teenagers about the movie and they would love to see it. They aren't into drugs but they know enough about them to understand the comedy in the movie. It's been so long since I've seen it I can't remember but a few things.

The Simpsons of course started off with Christmas special "Simpson's Roasting On An Open Fire" which had basic drawings and not laugh out loud jokes, but this episode has probably the first laugh out loud joke in it and from here the show just gets better and better. This episode centers around Bart who in this episode swaps on a test from Martin and gets into a school for the highly gifted, this leading to Bart mending his friendship with his Dad and losing all of his mates. The Episode is very humorous and shows what was to become the greatest show ever to come out.

If you expect that this movie is full of action and grabbing you from the start then don't watch it. But if you like those kind of meditative movies which stick in your mind for a while, until you get the details, then you will love it. Now don't get me wrong there is action and there are things going on just not in the usual way. Basically the plot is in a post-apocalyptic world where anyone fights in his (or their) way for survival. In this fight they lost the ability to speak...

I 've been a fan of Rachael 's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network , so I was thrilled to see that her new cookbook was finally available and available to purchase. I am so glad I decided to buy the book and I do hope it helps Rachael gain some more momentum in her pursuit of her goal of publishing her first book. Here is what I thought about the book. The book is well worth the $30 price point, but it does require some time to go through it.

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce shows that are on a level of quality that most people could never get away from? I can only think of a handful of shows over the last few years that I've enjoyed as much as True Detective. There are some people on this board that have some interesting thoughts. I'm glad to see that you are one of the ones. The proliferation of high quality shows has absolutely nothing to do with quality TV shows. Quality TV is a different beast.

Then again, I like Rachael Ray. She is fun, sweet, fresh, and such a joy to watch. I have to alter just about everything she makes as I am a vegetarian...but it's great to see her with a program that shows more of her personality. After all, she is a television personality. I think it's cool that she is so inviting with her fans and still appears to be down-to-earth. The studio audience appears to be rather small, but that just makes for a cozier environment. Some people have posted that the show sucks.

it's a good watch if u have time - deals with three friends who get into a needless bar fight, and get into serious trouble. they find themselves fighting some shadowy people, and can't deal with. very, very disturbing portrayal of japan, the arbitrariness of modern life... some intense scenes, but a bit of a potboilerthe spoiler was that the plot is not too clear based on English sub titles. obviously, i don't know Japanese.the only other Japanese movies i've seen were kurosawa, who is a different and far loftier than this modern genre.

It's just that. Chucky 1 was good. Chucky 2 was better. Chucky 3 sucked. Now, the 4th in the series which is, in my opinion, the best out of the series. Jennifer Tilly was just great in this movie. For dolls, they were better than a few actors that come to mind (Freddie Prince Jr, for one) and funnier than many comedies I've seen in the past.The plot wasn't great, but I really didn't care about it. Just to see Chucky and Tiffany bicker and fight each other.

This movie is a love story set in the backdrop of war . Everything about the movie was perfect . There's a wonderful chemistry between Aditya and Sreenu and their romance was so real . There are so many emotions through this story . The climax of the movie was intense and it has a very emotional scene . The cast was very professional . The film had a lot of action scenes . This was my favourite movie of the year . The story of the movie was so intriguing and the movie was well directed . I was really surprised by the plot and the characters .

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol ' says it all . I used to watch these when they used to have them. I love the way they are now. It's a nice change. It's a nice change on the way I was feeling. I don't want to have to watch all these boring commercials. They all start with 'I'm bored of this commercial' or they are about to show a new commercial or they are about to play a song. I hate all those annoying commercial jingles.

This show really is the Broadway American Idol . It has singing , the British Guy , A guy who really is British , a really good friend of a friend of a friend of the girl in the front row , the audience who really knows what is being sung , some really great singing , good comedy , and so much love and appreciation from all involved. So please give it a listen and I would be very grateful. Thanks! Sunday, September 25, 2012

I got to meet some of the people who work on this show.

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously, its primarily directed to fans of the series who are looking for a quick fix. Bronson (Paul Kersey)once again takes to the streets (given a license to kill by the chief police no less) and moves into his friends apartment (who you guessed it) was killed by a street gang that has taken control of the neighborhood (which looks like Beruit). It's funny that people who associate with Bronson have a habit of getting killed.

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (both out now), but director/producer/screenwriter Robert Rodriguez is out with a brand-new film, his first-ever for homevideo, and it's one that takes its inspiration from the world of toy cars that we've all had as kids—if not the cars that our parents owned, which was probably a lot more fun. It's called Cars 3, and it's a love story for all ages, even for a car lover like Rodriguez himself—a self-professed "mature" adult.

If you 've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts , here is a Zasu zinger ! In 1933, Pitts became the first professional athlete to appear naked on stage in an American play. He became known in his hometown of Pittsburgh as the world's greatest athlete, a symbol of freedom for all people of his time. Pitts spent the first part of his life as a boxer before breaking his left leg in 1930. He moved to Miami Beach, Florida during his rehabilitation and became a professional athlete and model for the male modeling industry.

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries ( Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island ) that keeps the viewer immersed in the world of a young couple. A lovely story of love and its consequences, a lovely movie to watch. I have already recommended it to my friends but I think everyone can see how beautiful it is. A lovely movie, full of emotions. I really loved it. I think that if you watched it on television or in the theater, it would take you 10-15 min to get through.

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius . And this movie is good ! Although the film does n't nearly reach the genius , it does reach the quality that is n't bad enough to be a waste to watch. The plot is good as always, it is well structured and well written with a nice plot to go with all the characters that we follow throughout this film. Although the story is well structured, the story does not last long enough but that is only a problem if we don't want to pay attention at all, which is a problem that is n't the case here.

(Some spoilers included:)Although, many commentators have called this film surreal, the term fits poorly here. To quote from Encyclopedia Britannica's, surreal means:"Fantastic or incongruous imagery": One needn't explain to the unimaginative how many ways a plucky ten-year-old boy at large and seeking his fortune in the driver's seat of a red Mustang could be fantastic: those curious might read James Kincaid; but if you asked said lad how he were incongruous behind the wheel of a sports car, he'd surely protest, "NO way!"

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback , and if anyone is confused about her past ( like I am ) Libby is her real name . And no, we don't know when the flashbacks are happening, I was only speculating . Libby was going to ask Desmond to take her to get a divorce. Then, she was going to tell Desmond that she didn't need him or any of the other boys in order to get her out of a bad situation. And, then, she was just going to go to college, and move out of her apartment, and have her own apartment.

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars (The Monkees and Victor Mature), or its director/co-writer (Bob Rafelson), but also its other co-writer (and brief cameo) Jack Nicholson. As it stands, most of them seem to shun it, and to outsiders the movie is regarded, at best, as a curio.While the T.V. series was famously based on the antics of the Beatles' 'Help! ', this film is also judged by the same accord. Yet far from the trite and painfully overrated Beatles films, and even the dated Monkees T.V.

"Live Together, Die Alone" is divided into three main story lines, and each one of them alone would have been enough for a great episode. So when you put all of them together, you have a great ^ 3 episode. It was a daring move to give the flashbacks of a season finale to a character (Desmond) who had only appeared in 3 episodes up to that point, but it worked: his backstory is absolutely fascinating to watch, both informative about the past of the island & the Swan station itself and honestly moving.

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear of being misunderstood. A good film that shows a lot of heart. Tuesday, May 29, 2010

The director of this film has been a friend of mine for a long time and I have always respected his work and the honesty with which he portrays his subject. His work is often very real and very intimate. This film is about the friendship between a mother and daughter that have had an unusual bond. Theirs was one of those closenesses that I think everyone has, even if they have never met.

Can the intensity of a husband's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime,despite betrayal on many levels? Tom Wilkinson is no brutal Othello, in the setting of modern day England. So, gradually a web of deceit begins to be woven. And, we witness cycles of jealousy and drunkenness and guilt and fornication. And so the web of "separate lies" begins to fail and then hold together again. And life (and death) goes on, despite the bright flame of the husband's love and the deep despair and guilt woven into so many lives.

I had the chance to watch Blind Spot in Barcelona and I enjoyed it tremendously. I thought it to be one of the most captivating movies that I'd seen for a long time. One of the best points of the film was to meet new fresh faces and great actors behind them in unexpectedly and brilliantly filmed great locations. The three heroes share a chemistry on screen that runs all across the film making it so thrilling. They are set on outstanding landscapes spotted by such an original eye (the DOP's work is just great) that makes you feel like you are discovering them for the first time.

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh : as the Monkees reduce their entire career to this, I can't help thinking: I'm not sure that the 1960s were as great as it sounds. It wasn't that there was no hope for the human race; it wasn't that there was no hope of happiness. But there was no hope that anyone could make a movie about what was going on, about the way people could be, if they really wanted to. In other words, there was no hope that anyone could write a good song about what we were going through.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it . It 's one of the worst films ever to hit the big screen. It is boring, boring and boring all the way. The movie is filled with dull characters, lame dialogue , lame plots , lame acting and stupid plot twists. It does not have any good performances. The acting is not as bad as expected. You can not say that they ' re not acting. Some of the lead actors are better than most actors in Hollywood. Some of their acting is better than many actors in Hollywood.

Spike Milligan 's books and plays have defeated film makers over the years , and 2002 's 'Puckoon ' is his only film since his heyday. We've spent time in Milligan's company for three reasons: to catch him doing something that he did, to see him play a part he did, and to play him in the only film to date that he's allowed to be a part of. This is our first trip to London to take in his home, and it turns out he's in no hurry to leave.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The film captures and interprets his artistic method ('sketching' poems), his inspiration (the spirit of nature and its fantastic beauty) and his struggles to accept a harsh reality in the face of his idealist imagination.The film integrated excerpts of Miyazawa's poems into the plot beautifully. His relationships with his students was powerful, especially in one scene where he offers everything he has to a student who has just been caught stealing materials from the classroom.

This is a 100 % improvement over the dross of a third movie and it 's one hell of a movie. If you like your movies dark and twisty, you must see this one! It has a little more of a feel to it than the original but it still works well for what it is. I would recommend this one to everyone who likes a movie that is a little more intense than the norm. There's a good story in here and it's all in good fun and it's not a movie that is going to waste your time, unlike the third one.

Between sweeping , extraordinary scenes within a plethora of Indian locations and a plot which is Bollywood inspired yet grounded in reality, you’ve got everything you’d want in a movie. The film has been a box office hit and is a must see for anyone who enjoys a film in the theater or who just wants to relax and watch the latest film from a Bollywood director. Watch the trailer HERE

The movie is a romantic drama in which Ashutosh Gowariker plays the antagonist and the lead roles are played by Deepika and Ranvir Shorey respectively, with a young Anushka Sharma playing their love interest in the film.

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I 'm dying to re-watch it. My dad watched this movie with me when I was about five years old so that's the only one of his favorites that I don't watch. I have never seen an episode in the series that I didn't like it. As I recall, every episode has its moments that you won't see in every episode, but you can usually recognize those moments if they're in one of my favorites. In my opinion, "The Big Chill" was a very underrated movie.

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it . It is just not available in my country anymore . But I think that it is very beautiful . So, if anyone knows where I can find it, please send me the link . I'd love to have this movie . I just watched the DVD, and it really is a great movie, I loved it. But I haven't figured out how to post it to you guys. Please help me with this and I will give you the link.

I love this movie a lot . I must get this on DVD . I have 2 VHS copies , 1 in my parents basement and the other on my old laptop. . The movie is good . I recommend it to people of all ages . You just have to sit through it and have patience . I loved it . I think it's one of my favorites . It's a very good movie . I recommend everyone watch it . You will like it

This movie is sooooooooooo good !!!! The story is sooooo good .

Really, This movie should be released to DVD. I just got a bootleg copy of what I think was a studio film and I was utterly pleased!!! It was on my list of films to own simply because of the cast. Three of my PEOPLE, Michael York, Olivia Hussey. Both having been in Romeo & Juliet, and also John Gielghud. sorry about the bad spelling, were in there so on that alone I thought that for the small amount I was spending it would be fine. Boy was I right.

Little Gus is a ten year old delinquent. He runs away from his parents and decides to go on a road-trip. Reaching the petal is somewhat tough for him, so he creates a device to help him. His goal is to win a gimmicky lottery type card game called Motorama. He has to find all eight letters in order to spell M-O-T-O-R-A-M-A. Dark laughter follows as it turns into the road-trip from hell. He runs into some deranged Lynch like characters. Most memorable is the gas station attendant, who puts his picture on a kite in hopes that God will see it.

( Some spoilers included : ) Although , many commentators have called this film surreal , the term fits poorly here. This is because it is not intended to be a surreal film by anyone else’s definition . The film does not have a conscious intention of making it seem surreal . In fact , it would be difficult to call this a surreal film , if that was the intention . The film doesn’t strive to make a point with this film . It wants to be a film that makes sense by its very existence .

This movie, based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt, is one of the best films I've seen on race relations in South Africa; a very good history lesson of the turmoil of 80's South Africa. I put it in on the scale of American History X as far as it's depiction of how a young man can get seduced by the Aryan doctrine and how the "certain" segments of the Christian church taught a false doctrine regarding race to justify an injustice.It's strong message of forgiveness and redemption, is one of rarity in films today.

(Synopsis) Graduating high school senior Bartleby "B" Gaines (Justin Long) finds himself without a college to attend. He has been able to talk and con his way out of every problem he encounters, but he hasn't been able to charm his way pass the college admissions board of eight colleges. His mom and dad are very disappointed that Bartleby hasn't been accepted into college. His parents think that if Bartleby doesn't go to college, he will have no future. Several of Bartleby's friends are in the same situation of being rejected by all the colleges they applied to.

The Child's Play series isn't a favourite of mine, but Bride Of Chucky is actually an okay movie. This time we have two dolls Chucky and his former girlfriend (when he was human) Tiffany. Together they go on a journey to find an object. There are a few interesting scenes through the movie like the guy getting hit by the truck and literally exploding, the sex scene between Chucky and Tiffany and the ending which allows for another sequel to take place. Wasn't really a straight forward horror, it mixed a lot of comedy and was a sort of spoof of the horror genre.

I saw this movie when it first came out in 1973 and loved it. Since then I've searched for a video but never found it until now, 33 years later, when I ordered it from Moviehunter. Sorry to say it doesn't hold up. This glamourized version just can't rise up to the 1937 production level. I love Burt Bacharach's musical score, that is if listend to by itself, and I even bought a CD of it, but for my taste it doesn't lend itself well to this mysterious and compelling story. Just doesn't fit.

Enchanting. The best time to see this movie is sometime when unhappy or sad. It's all just so cute, all, even the way that white bear loves the Queen in secret and gets Her in the end, also the achievement the two young actors of Gerda and Kai gave. It's music is also very nice. The two of us will always be one combined with sad piano tones in some places gives a very touching result and if one watches both parts at once, he'll see the Snow Queen is not so bad.

This film , like much of their music , is either underrated or unnoticed by the casual observer . It is a story about a trio of musicians , one a bass player , another a drummer , the third a pianist . The music that emanates from their soundbox is beautiful and very melodic . They have the ability to make a great live performance sound like a studio recording . I would love to hear them open for The Rolling Stones . They have toured in Europe , South America , the US , UK , Canada, Australia and New Zealand .

Little Gus is a ten year old delinquent . He runs away from his parents and decides to go on the run . . He runs through the woods and finds a small village with only four people. They are very friendly to little Gus . He finds a woman with an eye patch who was injured by a monster. He saves her and they form a friendship . The four of them become a family and live in a cottage until Gus is old enough to leave and return to his family. The story is told in third person .

Dr. Paul Flanner (Richard Gere), a successful surgeon, has his wife leave him, his son (an uncredited James Franco) not respect him and looses a patient he's operating on. Adrienne Willis (Diane Lane) has two children and discovers her husband has cheated on her. They both need to get away. She watches over a beautiful oceanside inn in Rodanthe at the same time he books a room. They're all alone together. You can pretty much figure out the rest.This is what's known as a weepie or a woman's film.

* Could contain spoilers , read only after seeing last episode season 2 * Think about it . The guys get a bit drunk, have sex and are on a plane when it gets sucked into a giant vortex. It's the same plane that they flew back to the future , only this time they get stuck in the past. They try to contact their friends , but they don't get any response and are then forced to crash land on the island. What's left are lots of dead bodies, some with strange alien symbols on them and a mysterious message that says "the end is near".

Spike Milligan's books and plays have defeated film makers over the years, and 2002's 'Puckoon' is sadly no exception. The novel, set in 1924, concerns the partitioning of Ireland, in particular its effects on a solitary community ( the 'Puckoon' of the title ). Due to a colossal blunder, half the village is now in Northern Ireland, the other half is in the Republic. Locals go to the toilets at the bottom of their gardens to find a barbed wire fence blocking their path. Drinkers crowd like sardines into a corner of the pub to enjoy a cheaper pint.

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies. Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 3 reminds me of "West Side Story" with a new twist. Not even the recent flick "Gangs of New York" can measure up with one New York neighborhood in Death Wish 3 which is plagued not by two rival gangs---but one big gang. A gang that is willing to do things like cutting a person to death with an ax if he trespasses on its set.Deborah Raffin, who plays a public defender, plays gently in this action-packed movie that is filled with a lot of shoot-em-up violence.

This is a stunning movie. Raw and sublimely moving. It felt like a very gripping, intelligent stage play (but without the overly theatrical feeling one actually gets from watching people on a stage) which plays on everyone's terror of a white lie escalating to monstrous consequences. All of the main players are mesmerising. Tom Wilkinson broke my heart at the end... and everyone else's judging by the amount of fumbling for hankies and hands going up to faces among males and females alike. Julian Fellowes has triumphed again. He's a national treasure.

This film was made right in the area where I grew up and now live. I know personally most of the property owners of the various locations used in the film. As a teenager, I worked in the fields surrounding the isolated road shown late in the film with Ron Perlman, Jonathon Furr, and the car. I am told that Jonathon Furr and Ben Allison are are natives of NC. I was fortunate to see it at a local showing. At that showing was one of the people who helped select locations and secure props, such as the bus (1938 Greyhound) used in the movie.

Great movie. Post-apocalyptic films kick ass. This one is no exception. Kept up the pace and interest without a speck of dialogue (mainly through some good character development). The fight between Reno and the Hero was tight. I also liked the use of cave paintings and medieval-like weapons to show how primitive and savage mankind had become without their technology and guzzaline. The connection between the beginning and end was a little spacey, that is, I had a hard time understanding the distances between the hotel and the opening sequence.

OK, so this film may not have won any Oscars, but it is not a bad film. The original "D.O.A." is undoubtedly a better film, but that does not mean this film is bad.The film stars Dennis Quaid in one of his early roles, when he was first becoming really famous, after "The Right Stuff" made him a star, and a very lovely looking Meg Ryan, when she was still now quite famous.This is more of an "update" of the 1950 film, rather than a remake, since the setting is different and the characters too, are different.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson 's work , and for about as long as I 've been alive, I've been a fanboy for his films . While there are many of these films out now , one of his masterpieces of the past few years is a very different one . The Fifth Element , as its various names have referred to it , has become something of a cult classic . It has been adapted in a number of ways in the past few years , including a successful TV show , but this was the first version of it that was shot in 3-D .

Ross Hunter 's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy , based on James Hilton 's enduring bestseller , was written and produced by Andrew Lloyd Webber. Hunter had previously written and directed the 1996 Broadway musical, which ran for more than a year on Broadway. For his new film version, he hired the original designer, Colin Stutz. He also reunited with Andrew Lloyd Webber with the score, with the original film score, music and new songs penned by Peter Allen. Also from the original Broadway production: the choreography was handled by Michael Bennett and the original book by Hilton.

To say the truth , I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor . As we all know , Nicolas Cage is the guy who looks the best on camera , but we also know that the truth is he's not really that handsome to look at, what we're all talking about when he says something like, " I wish I wasn't pretty , I wish i had a nose that would stop it from looking like this" or " I wish I had a chin that was a little fuller" .

It was Libby talking to Desmond in the flashback, and if anyone is confused about her past (like how did she end up in the same hospital Hurley was in) then you should know that despited Libby dying in season 2, the character will be explored more in season 3 and we will get answers to questions surrounding her.BTW, great episode. It had a really great cliffhanger and some interesting questions...like what happened to Eko and Lock and what about the four toe statue?I cannot wait till season 3, Lost just rules!!!

I believe that this is one of Elizabeth Montgomery's best performances in a movie, and I have seen most of her movies.I saw this for the first time on television when I was around fourteen, and I was so scared.I watch this movie every now and then, and I still enjoy it very much.I know that these days that this movie would probably not scare people too much.That just goes to show that the public movie and television audience has seen too much graphic violence in the last thirty years or so.I love movies that do not show the graphic details, you let your imagination do the work for you.

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old. I had no idea who Buddy Holly was, nor can I remember what it was that made me sit down in front of the television, tuned in to HBO, and watch this engaging biopic. What I remember was realizing that it was a (somewhat) true story, about someone who actually lived. I recall the music, great songs that I still love today (I can't believe Gary Busey sang his own songs and so well - What a stud!) Then, came the end.

This is what movies should aspire to. Funny without being totally stupid, a little sexy without having every female in the cast show her boobs, biting without resorting to 'f-bombs' every line. I've been seeing Justin Long pop up in a lot of films over the past few years, I figured with the right role he could break out. (Mac commercials not withstanding.) This film just might put him on a fast track to the A list. The rest of the cast also did their jobs perfectly, this is an excellent little film with a nice message.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it. It's one of the best "teenager" horror films I've ever seen; and that's saying a lot. Nothing is left without an explanation to back it up, the characters and plot break countless horror movie stereotypes, and it has got nothing to do with some other horrible pieces we've been submitted to lately. (A clear example is the mindless "Saint Ange".) The first 30-40 minutes might be downright boring with the exception of the beginning, although some minor light mistakes can be easily spotted.

Better than it has any right to be , this movie died a quick and painful death at the American box office on Wednesday , but I have to admit, I’d rather watch the movie today. In case you need a little reminder why this movie has been so divisive , here’s why you should watch it. (Warning, this is a spoiler-y post, but I promise we’re only going to talk about spoiler-y parts here)

1. You may have seen this movie. But you may have also seen other horror movies that were released at the same time that are better.

When I first saw this movie , I also expected `` our boys '' to be cute , and more of a kid fantasy . I was right . What I liked about it was the way that the main character , Danny , looked like he belonged in a child's book. He was very child like and innocent looking , and as the movie went on , I thought it looked like Danny might grow up to be a great young man. That was the way the movie played , with him as an innocent young boy who has been caught up in the war .

What an excellent movie , made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it while doing a little digging on the net. We’d never heard or seen anything like it before. We saw it on VHS as a double-feature with Jaws, we also saw it on cable back in the late 80s, but I don’t know where we got it. I had to make a phone call, and I found it through a guy who I thought was doing a movie or TV show.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film , The Life of Jimmy Dolan, directed by William Friedkin in 1968. The story is based on real-life incidents, with many similarities to the plot of Friedkin’s 1971 film The Night of the Hunter. The movie was remade in 2001 by director Kevin Reynolds, with an even more violent ending. The plot of the film involves a young boy named Jimmy Dolan (Jimmy Stewart, who would later become famous on the silver screen as Batman).

I thought Besson 's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them." He described the movie as "not a very good piece of work" because of its inability to communicate and the lack of characters. The film's ending is also not satisfactory. It has been considered to be the worst film in Besson's career. Besson himself has said that it was his worst work by far. Sequel
It was announced in October 2016 that Besson was developing a sequel to the film, entitled The Dictator, and that a trailer would be released by Netflix on 25 November 2016.

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job. He apparently received no credits. Too bad.All the Dead End Kids do their jobs beautifully in this 1939 entry. It is odd to watch them in a Western setting with their Brooklyn accents ( I guess that should be Bowery ). They even show some swimming abilities.I think there are many special scenes that can stay with the viewer of this boxing/love/crime story. My favorite right now is in the fight scene near the end of the film.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME . . . This review is the third and final part of the two-part review posted today. In addition to the two articles, please see part 1 and part 2 . . . I must say that I am a bit confused by a few things being posted here. I have always considered myself an LOST fan, but I find myself in a bit of confusion. I am not saying that any of these posts are incorrect. I just have a lot of things to take into consideration.

Jack, Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond. His traumatic past experience before sailing to the island is disclosed through flashbacks. Sayid plots a plan with Jack to surprise "The Others" in case Michael is double-crossing the group. John Locke convinces Desmond to invade the hatch, which is protected by Mr. Eko, and not press the button of the computer to see what will happen.This episode is one of the best of the Second Season. Unfortunately, we lovers of "Lost" can see the lack of respect the producers of this stunning series have with the fans.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie. I am not saying this lightly. I love movies and am fairly picky about them (my home DVD collection is over 9,000 movies - some are great, others are OK, a few I do not like at all). And, to all those with criticisms: this is a comedy. I simply love this movie. It is light, funny, and very restful. I am aware of all (or most) of the deficiencies but I love it.

Chaplin enters the trenches of WWI in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war . The raincoat and trench boots come alive as the young man and woman find themselves in the midst of it. Chaplin was just twenty-two when he made his first screen test in New York on July 18, 1916, but he soon found himself in a world he had never known existed and with a job he would never have gotten if he had not been in a position to do so at the beginning. The Chaplin Studio was the largest in the country, with about ten million dollars invested.

I saw the trailer and read some reviews , and I had low expectations for this movie . I was really surprised that I didn't expect the movie to be any worse than some of the other " action movies ". I was wrong , but I was pleasantly surprised . In the end of the day, the movie is a classic . It is one of my all time favorite movies , even though I don't go see it every year . I saw this movie in 4D , which wasn't bad at all . The 4D was a great choice , and it helped in the story .

Another great Tom Wilkinson performance punctuates "Separate Lies," a 2005 film also starring Emily Watson, Linda Bassett and Rupert Everett. Directed by Julian Fellowes, it's the story of a married couple, James and Ann Manning where the husband (Wilkinson) believes he and his wife (Watson) are happy together. An accident near their house on the night they have a party brings the police around. It is a hit and run that killed their maid Maggie's Bassett) husband. James becomes suspicious of a neighbor, Bill Bule (Everett) when he sees some damage on his car.

the first time I saw this movie, I just thought "what the hell?" a 10-year-old kid driving around bizarre places, meeting bizarre people, going after a game called MOTORAMA! Hell yeah! I enjoyed this movie a lot!Jordan Christopher-Michael is a brilliant young actor! It's a shame he stopped act. He interprets very well his character Gus on the movie.Gus loses an eye, got tattoos and go at the most weird cities acting with Flea, Drew Barrymore and Meat Loaf! Want more? OK, don't even try to understand the story, but why this movie needs one!?

I was 19 or 20 , years old at the time and living in Salt Lake City , Utah and wanted to play for the University of Utah , but I had a lot to learn. I started to play guitar , but was not really good , because I didn't practice that much. I also didn't think I needed to practice. But one day I was playing at a bar with some friends , and some people overheard me play and said , "Hey you're a pretty good musician , and you should join our band . "

I caught this show a few times when I was young and it was playing tilt , My parents loved it. I can't explain how much I enjoyed this show. It wasn't until a friend told me how much he loved this show that I discovered how great this show was. I would recommend it to everyone. The stories are so interesting and you can tell how the characters react to different situations. There are also many great stories in this show. Each episode has some type of action and most episodes have a couple of twists or a plot or two to go along with that action.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be. Terrible acting! Implausible scenerios! Ridiculous death scenes! Creepy, evil-for-no-reason villains! The last 30 minutes of this movie just might be the best 30 minutes ever put on film, especially in the scene where the decent, hardworking citizens string chains across the street, knocking down the evil bikers and then shoot them, only to be joined by the neighborhood children (!!!) in celebration. And how can I forget the elderly woman with the broom? She's sweeping out the scum!

1969 was the year . New York City was the place . Putney Swoope was the second Robert Downey film to be released. This page lists all the major films that have been released in each year. The page also has links to information about the films with information about cast, crew, and plot. 1930s

1931

(1931) – The Man Who Knew Too Much. Dir. Clarence Brown. US – Paramount. 115 mins. With John Barrymore, Joan Blondell, Wallace Beery, Margaret Livingston. The main plot of the film is about a man who tries to kill an ex-president of the United States.

My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film. I have got to say that I think everyone was impressed with how good this movie was. Though, my roommate didn't care for it but he's not into horror movies anyway and just went to see if Paris Hilton can act. By the way, if you're worried about that, don't be. I'm not exactly one of her fans, but I must be honest and say she was pretty good and she has the best death scene. Overall, all the actor's were very good.

What a shame this movie was never released . ( It is now playing on cable . ) I tuned into it at a time I could have easily missed it . But I would have , as it was part of the first week of the film season . While the main character of the film has a strong sense of justice , there are a few disturbing things to be seen . I thought about writing this review a few days before the film but I did not want to spoil the movie . So I am posting this review now and not in two weeks as I did with the film .

I was so happy to learn that Hari Om will finally be theatrically released in 2007 . I saw this movie a couple of times , but I never understood why it always seemed like it was about Hari , as it was not really about the character , the story was just an excuse to show her in a bikini. So , I watched this movie again and I finally get it. The movie is an interesting blend of adventure, comedy, action and some romance . It has something for everyone, both men and women .

Surprisingly effective British drama about two very different people who find common ground , and in particular the `` flowering '' of love between two people. As a drama, I enjoyed it but it is nothing like the play it pretends to be - the acting is so wooden as to be a bit silly. The characters are a bit likeable enough and their situations are quite convincing. I can see where they have been put up to it, but I do have to say they could have had more depth of character to them than they are given.

Blind Spot 's images are great . The action draws you in completely , even though the movie is a lot more of a downer in the first half then it gets to end. . If you don't have to see Blind Spot , I don't know what's the point. But I do. If you don't have to see it, then why did you watch it. The movie is good, but I felt it was more like a parody of the Hollywood "A-list". It was pretty funny, but I would like it to have at least one more movie in it.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it. It is the second time I've seen it, after being very impressed by a short it did a few years back. This one was so good that, as I recall, I sat down and watched it a few dozen times during that evening, before I realized it was the same one. It's also the one I kept replaying while I was at work, after work, while I was eating dinner, when I was driving, and so on.

I can not say this movie was a hilarious, but I must have had a grin on my face the entire time. I like this darker kind of comedy; "very bad things", "8 heads in a duffel bag" or "coldblooded"The way the main character tries to get away with murder is a lot of fun to watch. To me it was not much of a surprise what the ending would be, but the way that ending came about was. Another thing that sticks out, is the way they have managed to involve the audience.

Coming from the `` druggie '' generation , I thought this movie was hilarious . It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde back to life , and I have to say , I was pretty damn entertained . However , after a few minutes , the humor started to wear a bit thin . The movie is definitely one of those films where the laughs are over , and it is more of an emotional journey for the characters and the viewer instead of a laugh free ride . So I would recommend this movie for the first time visitor who is looking to go see one of the greatest films of all time .

Let me clarify that. This is not a "good movie", but I am so glad it is out there, I am so glad I saw it, and for the role that it plays in my DVD collection, it is sublime. It is the ultimate PG-13 romp, it is college as we imagine it will be when we're freshmen in high school, it requires so much suspension of disbelief that it may as well be taking place on Mars. It is so wholesome that even when it tries to be dirty it wouldn't make your grandmother uncomfortable.

Like some people here, I love/loved Stingers! In Norway it got aired a lot later. That also means that we are in the 176th episode. (yea, that's right) I have to say that I really love Stingers! It can make me cry, laugh, smile and so on. I think I'm going to die the day we reach episode number 192. Stingers might be the on series(except from Grey's Anatomy) that I really watch! The actors are amazing! Especially Jacinta Stapleton! Personallly I think she is one of the best access we have!

This is Christmas time! A nativity in terms of rebirth, or at least this is what can be hoped regarding the Italian cinema. It was something like 30-40 years that the Italian cinema didn't craft an art piece of this size. This is an absolute contemporary film that can be also regarded at the same level of quality as the Italian masterpieces of the past, needless to quote any name.
