Since this movie was directed by João Falcão, the same man who directed the play, it's not too much of a surprise that the film turned out a bit too theatrical.

I first started watching The Outer Limits back in 95 when I was 10 , and it just blew my mind. One of the greatest shows ever created, but it was also the only one I had the money for so I only had it for one season. I loved it, but I just had too much time to devote to watching and didn’t realize I had enough time to finish the series in the end. When I found out that the last episodes had already aired, I couldn’t believe it, but it was true.

I don't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor. You need to get your head out of your up-tight ass if you don't find this movie hilarious! If this isn't your "cup of tea", so to speak, then look at it for what it truly is- a damn funny movie. Maybe they DID set out to make yet another drugs/T&A movie, but in this case, they've truly hit the spot. It's especially funny for the Ali G fans, because he delivers everything we've come to love and expect from him.

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film (which is excellent). It borrows the main premise--a man has been poisoned and spends the rest of the film trying to find his killer. But I like that the writers chose an English professor, instead of a private dick, as the protagonist. The plot is also quite original. In general, the film moves along fast enough to keep you awake. But what mars this film is a strange dated quality about it (probably due to the horrendous 80's original music score)combined with an affected "noir" feel.

A labor of love . Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you . Then the sheer emotion and story-telling . I have to thank you all for your time and effort . You have all helped me to make this film what it is now. I can't say it enough, and I want to thank every one of you for everything. You have made me feel like a million bucks and made a movie that means so much to me and will mean so much to others as well. Thank you all so much.

An interesting look at the immigrant experience, told as a fable with some very weird imagery.I got drawn to this movie because it tells of immigrants from Sicily who traveled to America. I imagine much the same as my Grandfather did at that time. Travelling in steerage to provide ballast for the ships, I cannot imagine it was very comfortable, as shown in this film.Laws restricting immigrants existed. I would guess that these laws were more strict on those who came from the Mediterranean and Africa. Immigrants had to be free from contagious diseases or hereditary infirmities.

This has got to be one of the most magnificent things I 've ever seen on film . I do not consider it a film , however it is not a silent movie , it is full of sound and you can make out every word the characters say . The acting in it was superb , and I have been a fan of Griffith for years and years . The music was excellent and made the film even better. I am still in shock that I have to wait another 2 days for the release of the film , when I can see it in my neighborhood on dvd and on the screen at home .

This movie is true action at its finest, It doesn't get any better then this. This is one of those movies that you can just kick back and watch some real good non stop shooting and killing plus there are some excellent lines to go along with all of this. My favorite is there is a one bad guy who is breaking into this old couples home and he is stealing a TV or something and he goes right up to them and yells "I will come in here anytime i like!!!" and right before he jumps out the window he yells "Anytime!!!"

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME. The 1973 musical remake of the James Hilton novel about mythical SHANGRI-LA! is a real special gem. Music by BURT BACHARACH and lyrics by HAL David. A strange mixture of straight drama, adventure and musical sequences. It has the distinction of being the ONLY anti war musical fantasy ever filmed. This film was a critical and financial disappointment in the United States, but made a lot of money overseas. Only in America did it fail.

Gary Busey 's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography . Since had a musical background , he was able to tap into his inner child and play a little with it all by himself . And the kid in him was definitely happy with his role in the film which is about a little boy who is bullied by his older brother , and in the end wins him over . We don't have anything new about the movie itself which is a true story about two bullies in a small town in New South Wales in the 60's .

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . If you remember the 1974 film then you will remember Kersey was a " Conchie " during the Korean war and that he was physically sick after he committed his first execution . Ten years later Kersey seems to have learned unarmed combat and how to handle anti tank weapons in his spare time . But I`ll overlook that gaffe because DW3 is the best of the sequels , lowlife scum bags get shot dead , burned alive , their teeth smashed , and thrown to their deaths by middle aged housewives armed with sweeping brushes .

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie. It follows all the rules. Short scenes, to the point, cheap to shoot, guerilla-film-making, no sets (just disused buildings) and possibly an empty hospital wing. Also, even the black&white film-stock was a stroke of genius, probably selected more for its low expense rather than film effect, but it worked.Reno was amazing as the Brute. Everyone's acting was brilliant. The plot was simple and effective and no flabby bits left to distract you.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie . It follows all the rules of the Hollywood blockbuster, but instead of making the audience wait until the very last minute for the big twist, the movie introduces them in a way that makes the audience eager to know what happens next. There’s also a lot of symbolism in the narrative that’s not really explained by the main characters in the film; this is what makes The Dark Crystal look like a real film, but not one that is based on a book by Philip Pullman.

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n ' roll . The young singer/songwriter was born on July 25, 1937 in Tulsa Oklahoma, the same day Elvis was born. Holly's life spanned from age 5 to 17 when the family moved to Los Angeles. Buddy Holly was not only an innovator in his music, he also became a pioneer in the battle for racial equality and civil rights. In 1954, Holly moved to Memphis, Tennessee with his wife and 4 kids. There, the family settled in the suburb of Forest Hills and began their life in a black community.

I watched this movie out of a lack of anything else on at the time. Quickly the movie grabbed me with the depth of the characters and subtle plot. I was quite surprised to see that the rating given by my satellite provider did not show any stars.I will not give any spoilers to the plot-line or outcome but most of the characters had at least some redeeming value. Until the very last minute I did not know how it would turn out. Frequently, you can pick-up the formula and predict a story direction.

I usually give horror films around 6/10 , but this one caught my eye . House of Wax was by a French director, but I believe was produced by the U.S. The movie was about a woman who has lost her husband . She has a son with his new wife, and her son lives with her in the same apartment complex . The film opens with a funeral home in the background. It is shown through the eyes of the widow of the man who got killed . She walks through the streets with her young son .

it 's a great movie for the whole family . i do n't think many people have seen it cause i never read the books . anyway , this is the synopsis :

"an old man tells the story of his life . he lives with a wife and daughter , he gets to the age where he wants to take care of his grand-daughter so he moves in with his neighbors . he is an alcoholic . he meets an attractive woman who agrees to watch his grand-daughter so that she can make enough money for him to leave . he moves in with her and he has a terrible relationship with his wife .

That this film flopped at the box office, and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today, is a great pity - yet somehow rather appropriate. The commercial suicide the Monkees committed by making this film is mirrored by the metaphorical suicide they commit on-screen. To destroy so brutally their carefully constructed image as a wholesome American alternative to the Beatles is courageous to the point of rashness, as is the admission of being no more than pawns in the entertainment industry, trapped (in the movie, literally) in their own artificiality.

Chucky 's back ... and it 's about time ! This time , with the help of Jennifer Tilly and her incredible design team, we bring you the most beautiful, functional and durable dog bed ever made ! Chunky is proud to present the Chunky Big Dog Bed . I know this is a bit early, but there's a good reason. Chunky has been working on this design since it was first conceived. We are really excited to finally share it with you and are very excited to see what you guys think of it. I hope you'll let us know how you feel about it.

I've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months (maybe longer but not much). I was very infatuated with Olivia and I found Kevin to be very witty and the repertoire between them very good. Lately though it's starting to wear thin due to many factors for me. First my favorite segment is the first 15 minutes called Around The Net, that shows 5 video clips that you would find on a site like Youtube, that are generally funny, or of people getting hurt inadvertently (some intentionally).

SPOILERS BELOW`A Dog's Life' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing. In Charlie Chaplin's other movie from 1918, `Shoulder Arms', the silent film genius focuses on an entirely different brand of humor. His war comedy specializes in surreal, exaggerated set pieces in which Chaplin demonstrates unprecedented creativity and mastery of composition. When the soldier's bunker gets flooded, the water level reaches just the right height so that Chaplin can execute his gags most successfully. In a later scene, the soldier dresses up as a tree, a disguise that belies Chaplin's much increased ingenuity and goofiness.

This movie felt so real. I actually felt all of the emotions portrayed here during my life at various times - that of both Rory and Michael. I have Duchene's Muscular Dystrophy like Rory so what you see here is exactly what I've actually felt myself. Some won't believe there ARE disabled people like Rory, full of anger and rebellion. I know they exist because I'm one of them.The story is great. For a drama, character-driven movie, the story moves fast. I was never bored, maybe partly because I was seeing stuff that is close to my heart.

Some days ago, in Rome, a young Romanian man with criminal precedents assaulted and tortured to death a middle-age lady coming back home after an afternoon of shopping. A Romanian girl, who had seen everything, reported what happened.Therefore, it started a debate about the too much intense flow of immigrants from Romania, generalizing them as criminals, everyone, indiscriminately.I'm only 15, but I thought: what idea of affluence does Italy give to these poor people? How ever do they regard us as the Land of Plenty? Yesterday evening I finally saw NUOVOMONDO, and my question had an answer.

If you get a chance to get a hold of this lost ( for many years ) gem , I'd highly recommend giving it a try ! It's very well made , and sounds just right ! Great for background music or a solo instrument , just play it on it's own ! The only bad thing I can say about the thing is that you will find out very quickly that the sound is just not loud enough , and if you are lucky enough to have a really good sound system , the volume will never be loud enough .

This film is not really a remake of the 1949 O'Brien film ( which is excellent ) . It borrows a couple of scenes and features some very funny one-liners . But it does not have the energy or the heart or the humour that made the original film . It does have an interesting plot however , and has the potential of being a better film than the original . The movie has been dubbed into English , French , German, Spanish and Finnish . The subtitles do not make the film easy to watch , as there is a lot of subtitles in each language .

I 've never seen the original `` House Of Wax '' so I really did n't know what to expect. As you can see, there's still a bunch of characters that I would like to see and some things that they do that I like. I really did n't expect this much information in one book. What a lot of things there are to see. I guess that I didn't get the full picture. But, it is really a fun read and I will probably get into it more in the future. Good Job!!!

`` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is one of the coolest Italian horror films I 've ever seen , and a great example of how good Italian exploitation cinema can be when handled with style and care . director Giuliano Montaldo and writer Vincenzo Salemi ( who wrote the original story ) are at the top of form here , taking a well-worn story and making it fresh and scary . torturing a young duckling isn't new or unusual in film history , and it isn't unique to this story . what is unique is the way they handle it .

The `` old dark house '' sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the films that inspired it. But there’s some good to be had there, as we discover in a re-review of the film that was made first. That film was _The House That Shadows Built_ (1928). The script was by Bess Meredyth, the wife of a film director with the same name. This film was made with a small budget of about $4,500 and was based on a true story.

This is a remake of the anime classic from the 80's, and this one is even better. Sylia, Nene, Linna, and Priss are all back as the Knight Sabers in their hard-suits battling the robotic boomers. The animation is crisp, the characters are well-developed, and the action rocks. Priss is a singer in her regular job, so the series features some wonderful songs as well. There is a fair amount of violence, but most of it is against robots, and there is some fan service, but nothing too racy.

I have to offset all the terrible comments. I love this movie. I own the movie and the soundtrack. I watch it whenever I need a pick me up. Granted it's not like the Sound of Music but it's as much fun if picking at movies is not your thing. I adored the late (and great) Bobby Vann, and James Shigeta has always and will always be a favorite. I saw this when it first came out in the theaters. I'm a big musical fan and this one is 100 times better than Twiggy in "The Boyfriend".

In Tweety's S.O.S, Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that happens to carry a certain canary bird-and Granny, his owner. Uh-Oh! Once again, Tweety and Granny provide many obstacles to the cat's attempts to get the bird. Sylvester also gets seasick quite a few times, too. And the second time the red-nosed feline goes to the place on the ship that has something that cures his ailments, Tweety replaces it with nitroglycerin. So now Sylvester can blow fire! I'll stop here and say this is another excellent cartoon directed by Friz Freling starring the popular cat-and-bird duo.

As far as I know I 've seen most of Lucio Fulci 's films , with the exception of some Italian ones which are not available to me. But the way he made horror films was so different from all other horror directors , that I was always attracted to his style. And I think his style has evolved to some extent from that of his youth, where he showed a more direct approach to horror and a lot of violence. In this case he took some risks but he was successful with it. I think it is one of the most important horror directors ever.

I always liked this movie , I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it : ) . I know it's not for everybody but when you're in love with the idea that you want to make a movie like this , it's good for all of you . The story is so unique and beautiful and I think it deserves all of the success it has so far . The best thing of this film is how it was filmed . It really was a unique idea but it works so beautifully on the screen.

At one time `Buddy Cop' movies ruled the box office. It seemed that every summer flocks of Beverly Hills Cop wannabes descended on our nation's theaters. Not any more. Lately the gusher has dried to barely a trickle. The drought has eased a bit recently with the release of Showtime, a movie that is a genuinely funny and consistently entertaining example of the genre.Mitch Preston is a dedicated cop. He's not a Dirty Harry type by any means. He's just incredibly focused professional who's completely intolerant of anything that gets in the way of the performance of his dutieslike, say, a T.V.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel,I have to say out of all the shows that I've seen that ADV released,this one is one of the best shows of all time. I had to see it again,and that's when I got my chance. I bought the entire box set of this series at Best Buy for my 20th Birthday. And I got to enjoy it,and see more of the episodes that I missed on Action Channel,and the same 3 episodes that I've seen.

I went to the pre-screening of `` Rory O'Shea Was Here . '' I like this movie better than I thought I would. It's not perfect but it is really well made, well paced, well acted, and has some great moments in it. I have no idea what this means. But I'm hoping that it's an improvement over the last film, which was so awful and boring that I just couldn't get through it. It just seemed like a really boring and boring movie, with no redeeming value in it.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen : much better and deeper than Luhrman's movie "I Want Candy". I was not expecting something so good, because in my opinion Snow Queen (or Snow White) is the worst kind of princess in literature. But I was surprised when I realized, that there is some kind of truth and reality in it. The plot of "Snow Queen" is so simple, and its execution is so great that I was convinced that it is a perfect movie.

by TyNesha Mells . In this drama , Ja Rule , who stars as Reggie , struggles with the loss of his brother to cancer. As he struggles to come to terms with his brother's death , Ja Rule is forced to go through his own personal struggles that include learning to accept the fact that life isn't as perfect as he had hoped. While it's a solid story , I don't find the drama to be as engrossing as I would like . In fact , with all of the drama going on in the storyline , I was having a hard time watching this movie .

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time. Excellent original music, clever, heady...it's hard to be articulate about something this good. There isn't one character that you don't instantly love to watch- Myronex "Putney, there's trouble in the black room!" "My name is Rufus." The lines, thrown away left and right, are classics themselves, recalling Slapshot, Caddyshack, Anchorman, Repoman, Dolemite, any comedy whose dialog is not of the formulaic set-up punchline variety. "Putney, Myronex called you tasteless!"

I'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci's films. Most of his 80s gore films had their moments, but often came across as second-rate Dario Argento imitations. With the exception of the entertaining "Zombi" (which was a George Romero imitation), I didn't really enjoy them. I know Italian horror often disregards the plot, but the storyline and characters in his films were just far too thread bare even by the standards. This is why "Don't Torture a Duckling" surprised me. Its actually a very well made film with an engrossing murder mystery.

Lucio Fulci, later known for his graphic horror films like The Beyond and Zombie, was years earlier a master of the Italian giallo (in the company of Argento and Bava) with films like A Lizard In A Woman's Skin and his masterpiece, Don't Torture A Duckling. This film has all the elements of the Italian mystery/thriller genre known as the giallo, but really pulls the viewers in by having each key character with a skeleton in his/her own closet. This keeps you doing as much detective work as the detectives in the film itself. Who is killing the young boys in town?

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort, and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. This patriotic and propagandist picture is part of his contribution, although the war was nearly over by the time of its release. The tramp goes to war, humorously accomplishes acts of heroism and kicks the Kaiser in the bum. It's a very funny film, although I don't think it nearly one of his best. It's with 'A Dog's Life' as his better output for First National before he made his early masterpiece 'The Kid.'

This is one of the finest TV movies you could ever see. The acting, writing and production values are top-notch. The performances are passionate with Beverly D'Angelo superb as the older woman with a teenage daughter and Rob Estes simply perfect as the young stud boyfriend. However, the best part of this film was how it showed the consequences of sexual abuse instead of going for the usual happy ending. It showed that abuse can happen in good families; involve good people; and wreck lives. It is thought provoking and entertaining. Congratulations to all concerned with this exceptional movie.

For those out there that like to think of themselves as reasonably intelligent human beings, who love film, have good attention to detail and enjoy indie movies with funny, smartly written dialogue then this is a film for you.For those with a poor attention span, high expectations and no brains.. well.. um.. you may get bored and find things dragging at times.This is a charming, modest and well paced movie with the actors bestowing a real sense of depth and warmth to their roles. I chuckled to myself pretty much the whole way through..This film is a little gem.

Exclusively for Coop's lovers, though Clint Eastwood very strong though unobtrusive presence is a great asset of this very good documentary film. It is a biography of Gary Cooper, based mainly on his filmography, but also on more private archives, which show him as a child, as a young man, as a family man, with some of his friends (Picasso, Hemingway, etc. ), as an older man, finally as a sick and close-to-death man. After "the end", I did not have the feeling that I knew the man any much better.

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I've seen in a very long time. Granted I spent much of the first half an hour wondering what the hell was going on but once I had accepted that I would never understand everything from the subtitles I was able to enjoy the film.Can you really hate a film where a staff turns into a flock of birds that defecate over the enemy? What does character development matter when faced with a lesbian alien princess whose people built the pyramids? Why does Buddha wear seriously blinging diamond earrings?

Based on a William Faulkner short story, Two Soldiers is a top notch short film, a movie that has enough story, emotion and great cinematography for a feature film and definitely leaves you wanting more in the end. The story involves two dirt poor Mississippi brothers, one only a kid, the other old enough to volunteer for the war effort shortly after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. The younger brother, played brilliantly by newcomer Jonathan Furr, doesn't want to let his older brother go, and he sets out on a quest to enlist in the Army himself.

Lucio Fulci 's `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by poverty and crime. But if there's one movie to make the case for Fulci's work as the very best Italian crime-movie director of the early- to mid-'80s, that movie would be `` The Death of the Innocents ''--not just because of the plot but because he made one of the great Italian-American performances of the decade, and one of his best. It's also one of my favorite films of his, period, because it was also one of his best films.

Hey look, you don't watch this movie to change your life! But if you are female especially and have always had a little thing for Richard Gere; this movie is right up your street. Diane Lane and Richard Gere have on screen chemistry going way back. 'Nights in Rodanthe' is not a Oscar winner movie and it will probably be forgotten sooner rather than later but if you want an atmospheric, beautifully shot love story between MIDDLE AGED good looking people (they don't make your stomach turn and even when Gere is 'on top' he does not look too jowly) then this is the movie for you.

These critics need to find a new job ! ! ! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY , so we should not be so quick to criticise, but to give a fair and objective evaluation based on what the movie portrays in it's context. So far I've rated it 2/3 and i will continue to review it as I think it deserves to be much better. I hope it is better that the last movie. There was a time when you could go to Hollywood and see the best movies ever made and just sit back and relax.

I thought this was movie was great, Richard Greico and Yasmine Bleeth have great chemistry in this movie. Yasmine Bleeth's character plays a women who has fallen head over heals in love with Richard Greico's character. They end up getting married and everything seems perfect except Yasmine Bleeth wants a baby more than anything, however she has a hard time trying to conceive. Richard Greico will do anything to make her happy, and will go to extreme measures to make her happy. I thought the acting was great in this movie, and it keeps you guessing.

( Synopsis ) Graduating high school senior Bartleby `` B '' Gaines ( Justin Long ) finds himself without a place to live, and unable to afford rent. He takes a job working part-time at his mother's bookstore. He is fired for missing work and has to take a $200-a-week job at a fast food chain, where he is made to work the night shift. Soon after starting, he learns that his new job is a temp position that is supposed to be temporary, but he's not sure if it will last more than one week.

Let 's be fair : there are no RULES for scriptwriting , so I wo n't say the movie SHOULD be like that but you can make up your own mind for the story line , as you want it. This is my first script . I'm a writer myself but this is my first script and it's all about the story , so I'll give it some thought and then I'll post the finished product later on. I'll do it in as much detail as possible . This story takes place in the near future .

I think that this short TV series, was absolutely wonderful, and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of everything that was on the screen at the given time. This was by far David Attenborough at his best. I personally thought this was one of the best documentaries in the past decade. This is definitely worth peoples money!I also found the bit about the abyss and deep water the most fascinating and interesting part. It was incredible to find out that the 'Blue planet' team discovered more than 10 new species of underwater life!

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling and more than reasonable elucidation for the genre. Personally I think he has been unfairly maligned throughout his career as an aesthete of gore. It's a pretty capable procedural and surprised me with its subtextually rich narrative that shows his distrust for small minded small-town mentality and the inefficiency of the police, as well as the twisted ideals of the Catholic church, the last of which seemed to have cut this film at its knees when it was first released and could have possibly given the director another direction so early on.

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918 , a doughboy who can not seem to get the girl. Chaplin goes in search of his girl and finally meets her on the train, but he cannot make her his girl , because she is just a girl. But the boy does not know that he can find the woman that he never had the chance to see. It seems that every man wants to find the right woman. But the boy needs to find the right woman for the woman he is looking for is not easy to find.

by TyNesha Mells. In this drama, Ja Rule, who stars as Reggie, struggles with the loss of his father. His old friend J-Bone, who is a cold-blooded thug recently released from prison, helps Reggie find who murdered his father. A week after his dad died, a preacher, Reverend Packer, came up dead. Reggie was suppose to be the one to kill him, but did he? Did Reggie kill Reverend Packer or was it some type of a setup? Back in the Day also has a couple of romantic scenes.

The revelation here is Lana Turner 's dancing ability . Though she was known privately to be an excellent nightclub dancer she was not particularly known for her dance skills, she was actually a terrible dancer in private life . It is thought that when the film was made a few days before she died she took her dancing clothes off to have a dance with John Barrymore . And she certainly was not the only famous person to have their dance partner strip off before a dance . A friend of hers once said that she always wanted to be a stripper but that she could never become one because she is a lady .

I loved this film ! ! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it on the big screen and I was so excited to see it on the big screen. As for the plot, it was absolutely amazing and amazing. I felt like I was in a movie in the theater watching it and I was in awe because it was just the right amount of intense and the right amount of silly at the same time. I was surprised at the amount of gore I saw. It was all done to make you feel as if your in a horror movie and not in reality.

I'm not a massive Disney fan, but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them, so we've built up quite a collection, and this is one of my favourites. We first saw this a couple of weeks ago and we must have see it half a dozen times since! OK, as others have pointed out, not the most complex or inventive of plots, but there's more to a film than that.Great characters, Phil Harris stealing the show as Thomas O'Malley, but Edgar the butler not far behind.

Loved today's show!!! It was a variety and not solely cooking (which would have been great too). Very stimulating and captivating, always keeping the viewer peeking around the corner to see what was coming up next. She is as down to earth and as personable as you get, like one of us which made the show all the more enjoyable. Special guests, who are friends as well made for a nice surprise too. Loved the 'first' theme and that the audience was invited to play along too.

This movie , based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt , is one of the best films I 've seen recently. The plot and the acting were so good. I was amazed how they did make the story a little more like the real one. The actors were able to do such good acting. One of my favorites of this season. The music and the sound made me cry. And it was all worth it! Go see this movie. It is so worth it. The acting by the main and supporting players are really good. The story was excellent.

Captain Corelli's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good. I have to admit Ms Cruz can really act. She puts on a very good performance. In fact she our does her boyfriend Tom in drama. John Hurt was great as usual. Nicholas Cage seemed to be enjoying himself. I bet he felt he was going back to his roots as an Italian. However, I did learn something. One more chapter in Horrors of Nazi Germany the many Italian soliders killed during the period of there surrender to the allies and Germany's eventual surrender.

The film isn't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch. I am the first one to agree that Victor Fox isn't really that attractive and his music and style are pretty cheesy. I also agree that the film has some odd distractions and some scenes don't work well. So what? If it makes you smile and you enjoy it who cares? Does every film have to make sense? Does every film have to be perfect? No. A person could get razed admitting that they love this film. Again, so what?

This musical has a deep meaning which is appreciated by only a few. The wise can see the wisdom contained in what most call folly.This music may well regain popularity as world consciousness rises. It is about a land "far away from it all" where "living things have room to grow." Its people are "living and growing together" mentally and spiritually faster than in biological age.The lyrics help us recognize the relativity of this "world that is spinning around" and to "look inside yourself; that is where the Truth always lies."

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius. And this movie is good! Although the film doesn't nearly reach the quality of the tv-show, it's still very funny and has some seriously wicked moments! I've liked Ali G since the first time I saw the material from the show. I think he's one of the best comedy characters of all time.. up there with say, Peter Dragon ("Action") and The Blues Brothers. Biggest surprise with this film was that they've actually got some serious actors to do it (Dance and Gambon).

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply wonderful performance. Diane Lane is so charming that she can take any man’s pants off, including Richard Gere's! She's been married twice to men who were not her soulmate, yet she's remained faithful to them. Now, after a whirlwind romance, Diane has decided to settle down. Then, the most unexpected visitor arrives. The woman he thought was his soul mate has left him for another man. How will Diane deal with this shocking turn of events?

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn 's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architect of the Capitol, William Thornton. The film's main narrative concerns how Nathaniel, a man who does not know how to make a living in the world without his Architect's help, tries to escape the cycle of poverty for the betterment of his life. The story is interwoven between Nathaniel, William, and the architect's widow Elizabeth, whom Nathaniel's son, Richard, befriends when Richard is in his early teens. Nathaniel's search ultimately leads him to his own self-discovery.

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films , it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment . The film opens with us watching a young girl looking at her father's dead body . We cut to her standing by a window looking through a viewfinder . She looks so beautiful it breaks my heart , you can just see it , she is the only woman in the world that does . The camera pans away from the dead man and the girl looking out and we see a very beautiful city . We see a man talking to his daughter by the door .

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO , regardless of the age of the OAV . The plot and characters are both a bit weak and uninspired , particularly the characters in the original story. If you are a fan of the original series , there’s not too much that you won’t like here , but otherwise, I would just recommend this OAV as something you can watch as a fan of both series. The original story of the “OAV” is the best part of it, so if you want a better look at the story , go ahead and rewatch the series.

I hope, from his seat on Heaven's comedic throne, Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film, as Terence Ryan and Ken Tuohy have taken a book that the author himself said writing it "nearly turned me mad" into a joy to watch.The film tells the story of the Irish town of Puckoon and the problems befallen upon it when the partition between Northern Ireland and the Republic is drawn up, cutting its way through the centre of the village and, more worringly, through the middle of the churchyard.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange. I was confused, sad and happy in the same moment. I guess that too less people will pay attention to this movie. But I hope that at least a few will see it and get something out of it. The story of two friends, linked by their suffers of bodily disability, whom (as a team) beat the medical well-fare system and fight for their rights. This movie shows a side which some of us would never understand, not too exaggerated but emotional presented.

Years ago when I first read John Irving's The World According to Garp, I was astounded that most of the younger adults with whom I had contact didn't like the book when I loved it. I began to understand that it was an age and experience thing. I experienced somewhat of a déjà vu when reading some of the comments on this site that were clearly written by younger viewers. Fully enjoying Separate Lies is surely an age and experience thing.In this film the viewer sees a seemingly happy upper middle class couple - he a successful lawyer - she the perfect wife of a successful lawyer.

The young John Garfield turned in a fine performance in the 1939 "They Made Me a Criminal." Celebrating a ring victory in a jammed locker room, boxer Johnnie Bradfield emotes about his love of mom, rejection of booze and clean living style to fans, including cops, who eat it up. Later in the evening he's plowed and tussling with his bimbo gal while his manager, in on the con, shares the evening. And the whiskey.A problem develops when another couple arrives. The guy is a newspaper reporter and he says he'll expose Bradfield's phony life on the front page.

I do n't see that much wrong with this movie . Granted , the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti and Antonio Scotti , but they are pretty good and the orchestra is great . I had the pleasure of hearing the movie in a private screening before a group of college students and it was really well received . I have seen more of this type of movie , but this one is better . A good movie, but the acting is so bland and the plot is far from original it's not even funny.

If you've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts, here is a Zasu zinger! In 1933 Mae Questel caricatured Pitt's voice for the character Olive Oyl for the Fleischer Studios animated cartoon version of the comic strip Popeye. Zasu (pronounced Zay-Sue) does her best "Olive Oyl" impersonation walking around whining and ringing her hands or attaching herself to the policeman's laynard. I kept waiting for her to say "ohhh myyyy", but instead it's "something always happens to somebody." The first time I saw this film I loved Zasu and found her character really funny.

The show start out with the boat . Desmond was i it . Then they went to try to save him . Then he said that he just had to save his brother. Desmond went to find him. They get into an ice cream shop . They got on a boat , but then he left . After that he got back with his brother to try to save him . I love the part where he leaves the boat and is on a boat trying to find his brother who is being attacked . He gets to the boat , and there is his brother , in an attack on a man .

Saw the film at the closing gala of the Ealing Film Festival in West London(England). Enjoyed it immensely. Although the Crow & the Chinese Policeman don't appear, and Dan Milligan becomes Dan Madigan (played by Sean Hughes (I)). The interaction between Dan and the Author (Writer/Director) voiced/played by Lord Richard Attenborough, works very well.The rumour is that Lord Attenborough and Elliott Gould (as Dr. Goldstein) appeared in the film for just a pint of beer.Spike was shown the film, on video before he died and by all accounts enjoyed it immensely.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film . It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the joy of living life. It was filmed on location in the town where this family lives and was a pleasure to watch in a small town where we grew up. I enjoyed it immensely. This film is a must for any young child to watch as they grow. This film should not be missed. This is a touching film about two children from different backgrounds who are reunited and become friends during their stay at a family’s house for a short visit.

Being a middle aged mom myself, I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in the many issues that effect us. Diane Lane beautifully portrays Adrienne and the sacrifice and conflict that a mother goes through, wanting to do what is right for her children, but still have a happy life herself. I am not a big Richard Gere fan, but he always does a good job with the guy who is sort of jerk, but learns something about himself.Criticism of their romance as unrealistic is hardly justified when compared to most other romantic movies.

The movie is excellent . Acting , cinematography , direction and music are spellbinding . It seems to me that there are more people in this movie than this world . If you are a fan of good movies then I suggest you get this movie . There is a reason that I give this movie 5/5 . The movie was good. The acting was a bit boring, and the cinematography could use a little work. The story was a bit unbelievable. I am not even a movie fan, so I can't say that much.

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something "not human" is portraying human beings and I think that this film is one of them. Apart from a few points of the plot and the characters - this film could be changed with all people rather than mainly animals. Although - it's good someone did not - I feel the cats are jolly good in this film portraying humans! :-)This film also focuses on quite a lot of adult issues - which is rather odd for a Disney film.

It's Showtime! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro's careers. It's an entertaining movie and a guilty pleasure but not quite up to the actors' standards, especially not Robert's. Showtime is directed by Tom Dey and features some small roles from guys like William Shatner and Mos Def.Showtime is about two very different cops, Mitch Preston (DeNiro) and Trey Sellars (Murphy). One takes work seriously in a low profile, quiet manner while the other is more easy-going and wants to have more fun than felons in his back seat.

Surprisingly effective British drama about two very different people who find common ground, and in particular the "flowering" of one of them. An embittered, "Spike"-type youth (McAvoy) with Deuchennes MD is placed in a home for the disabled and quickly makes friends with a youth (Robertson) with cerebral palsy. Robertson has never known anything outside of the home, but McAvoy has and he is bound and determined to get back into the real world. Together, they manage to do just that in this funny and heartwarming and often heartbreaking tale of inner strength overcoming physical shortcomings.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar ! The film took a while to pick up from the start, so it's not often we get an extended trailer to give the movie a chance to make an impact. In this case the extended trailer is well worth checking out, because it makes the film look like something special. The extended trailer does, however, look like it's missing some shots, so make sure you check back in a few weeks to find out what went wrong with the film, and to see if we're gonna be seeing an extended edition.

In this era when almost everything makes it on to DVD ( I 'm expecting to see the My Mother's House movie on next Tuesday for example ) I'm getting a bit fed up with people who say " DVD is not for you! " . I've only bought one DVD for myself, and it's been a few years since then but the first thing I did when getting a brand new DVD player was to try the demo disc. The demo disc is just a disc of about 10 minutes of the film and then a few minutes explaining what the movie is all about.

Better than it has any right to be, this movie died a quick and painful death at the American box office. At times sophomoric, at others, bitingly satirical and witty, Jekyll and Hyde is mostly just a near perfect reflection of the times, laden with drug and sexual humor, reminding one at one time or another of everything from the Woody Allen of "Everything You Always Wanted To know About Sex" to the Mel Brooks of "The Producers", Saturday Night Live to Monty Python, Carlin to Cheech and Chong.

This film is an impressionistic, poetic take on the immigrant experience, a reflective look at the turmoil and fear which might be associated with emigrating. These are aspects not often considered in movies about emigration to America in particular and to to any country more generally and the film vividly and convincingly depicts the nervousness and enthusiasm, if ignorance, that poor, illiterate Sicilian immigrants have in anticipation of their emigration to the United States. They have some fantastic, unrealistic notions about the United States which are disseminated on the trip over.

it 's a good watch if u have time - deals with three friends who get into a needless bar fight after a girl leaves one of them by accident (in the movie the friend who left her by accident happens to be a woman). This movie was one of my faves. And I can't forget the scenes in the subway at night in the cold and the scene where a woman hits her boyfriend. And of course the song in the movie where the character sings the song in the subway to her man. The lyrics are great: "I can't get you out of my head.

Years ago when I first read John Irving 's The World According to Garp , I was astounded that most critics thought it a "bad" novel. Now it is widely recognized that one of Garp's strengths is that he is able to bring to life so many of his characters. What's even more impressive is his ability to bring to life characters that he is not sure he has a real sense for, because he doesn't spend enough time with them to truly understand what it is that makes them tick or to fully empathize with them.

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television (RTL7, around 1800hrs) and I still watch it! I don't like the A-Team... I absolutely adore them!! It is just great to see Justin chasing the former members of A-Team. Brings back memories from the old days, when I was young an sweet. I would have given you a 10 for excellent, but Justin looks like he is chasing the former A-Team members all by himself. Of course, that is the only bad thing on this documentary.

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode, THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best episode of the series. And, while I have always loved A PIECE OF THE ACTION because it is so much fun, I really do have to cast my vote as this Romulan episode as being the very best.The movie, interestingly enough, is really like a WWII submarine movie in that it bounces back and forth between the cloaked Romulan ship and the Enterprise as it seeks to destroy the Romulans before they sneak back across the Neutral Zone after a raid on Federation outposts.

The Monkees , surprisingly , are a big favorite of mine . Yes , they might have been the original “ rock and roll” band, but they were also a major influence on the entire pop culture for the past three decades. From “ Monkees: A Rock and Roll Play” ( 1973 ) to their most recent album, the Monkees , there was always something new to keep them on everyone’s radar. It’s no secret that they wrote a whole bunch of their most famous songs on “ Monkees ” , a song I wrote and sang in high school during my freshman year of high school.

OK so Paris Hilton sucks in it ( typical Malibu Barbie ) but the rest of the actors are just so good. I would never have guessed Paris is such a great actress. I was actually surprised. I thought I would get bored watching her but I found her very entertaining. The plot of the movie and it's ending was really good too. I didn't expect it to be so emotional and sad like I felt it was, but it was touching. I loved the way Paris reacted to her parents and her mother was a great character as well.

I just thought I would add another observation, here. While there are a couple of visual sub-references, in this episode, to the possibility of unexpressed feelings between Jim Kirk and Yeoman Janice Rand; there is a special, physically tender, moment, toward the end. When the Enterprise is reversing at emergency warp speed in an attempt to outrun a possibly fatal Romulan plasma ball, Janice, perhaps fearing that their life is about to come to a dramatic end, seeks comfort by placing her head on Jim's sympathetic shoulder as they observe the aproaching instrument of their impending doom on the main viewer.

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage 's better films . He turns a fine performance as the singer in this tale of life , love and tragedy . He does have to do a lot in a small film , but he handles it very well , especially for someone who is so well known . When I read a review of a film, it is rare that I can't help but be drawn in . The same goes for the film I am going to be discussing , and that review is from a very reputable source .

I saw this movie on it's opening night, and enjoyed it. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I hadn't been sitting by my father. The thing is, he didn't understand that the creators were slightly making fun of the horror genre with the film. In every horror movie, there is always a certain character depicted.

Let me clarify that . This is not a `` good movie '' , but I am so glad it exists . It has everything a good movie needs:

- great actors- good plot- a good ending- good cinematography

And then there were four . Two had good performances, the third had great performances but was missing something, and the last two were just okay . I am happy they were okay . Now let me explain what makes a movie good . 1 - Great Actors

This movie may be the best ever if you like watching movies and laughing and then subjecting your friends to that movie. It's not only that it's funny and funny movies that are funny, the movie was funny and funny and funny and funny and funny. It was the best kind of movie to watch with your kids. It wasn't the kind of movie you have to sit in front of on the big screen, or watch in the theater to enjoy. And it was the best way to see a movie at all, with your children in the room.

Pity the Monkees. People always accused them of being manufactured (which they were) or being nothing more than a American knock-off of the Beatles (Again, which they were) but to the kids of the time they were real, they were important, they were legitimate. Discussions about who were better The Monkees or The Beatles were common on school yards but the critics, well they never quite bought into it. Despite recording some very catchy, classic pop tunes, the Monkess did not receive much respect for their albums.

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary . I knew it was about child sexual abuse , which is one of the biggest crimes in our history . But I also knew this is a story that takes place in Europe . So what I was going to discover was a European issue . I had no idea what Europe had done to help the survivors of child sexual abuse . I had no idea about the role the EU was playing , nor that the European Parliament played an essential part . So what I discovered was amazing .

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in ! I love watching him ! ! i hope he does more movies ! ! I am so so so happy i got to watch him ! ! I love Langella ! I agree that this is ONE of the very best episodes of the entire series -- my only detraction would be that I think it might have been a little overused at some points. But it worked very well for the story and it was very entertaining. As I mentioned in my reviews of previous episodes I think that the writing has improved significantly since the first episode. I would not hesitate to rate this episode 5 out of 5. As always with these types of episodes, I believe that it is best that the audience watch the first three or four episodes first to understand what the story is about.

I think it definitely is . The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language (who may not have any background in poetry) can read it on their own as if they’ve read a book of poems or novels. It takes me a while to get into the language, but I’m learning a lot from these books. When I first heard that this book was going to be released in October I think that I was pretty happy about it. I would love to be able to read them all in one go, if it’s possible.

This movie is beautiful in all ways. It is visually stunning, and this is a good thing since the dialogue would only take up a page or two of paper. The acting is superb; it is subtle, passionate and intense. Ben Daniels does a fabulous job of turning himself into an animal, and mixing that wild nature with a man's overbearing passion and honor. There is not one flaw, not one mistake or wrong moment to be found anywhere. It is completely perfect, but only if you understand what you're going to experience.

This is a well directed Columbo episode, with also some good character but the story just doesn't really know to interest enough and doesn't appear as well layered and constructed as was often the case with a Columbo movie. This also goes for the killer's plot to kill his uncle. It's quite simple and doesn't seem as well thought out. Perhaps this movie didn't really took itself serious enough, since the atmosphere of the movie is mostly light. At least when compared to different Columbo movies.For instance the movie features quite a large amount of comical relief, mostly coming from the Columbo character himself.

A beautifully photographed and paced short film. It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the country during the period just prior to and after Pearl Harbor.I appreciated the visual look of the film -- naturalistic and simultaneously poetic. Great work by a great D.P., David Boyd.Though a family film, the story never becomes maudlin or saccharin. We understand and believe the motivation that propels the young boy on his odyssey. I understand the love of the younger brother for his older brother and do not question why he sets out to do what he does.

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of India. A journey that will take us deep and far into its ancient roots. The journey is a spiritual one and the journey will be filled with magic, mystery and spirituality. Let’s take our journey together as we embark on our spiritual and intellectual journey in India. Let’s start off by sitting down to enjoy a good cup of tea, a cup of warm milk and let us talk about these two beautiful places.

When `` Madame '' decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble . The snobbish Butler Edgar who takes them all under his wings is not the man to nurture the kittens. Especially the one-eyed kitty. When the Butler discovers what he's up against, he has no choice but to admit to himself that the cat with no tail may be a cat with a whole lot of hearts. Celibate or celibate are words used to describe men. But they can be used to describe anything in life that is contrary to the rules. The Butler finds that there is more than one kind of celibate.

This is one of Chaplin's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more mature United Artists features. More opulent than the Mutual films, it continues Chaplin's quest for perfecting his comic expression. Most people forget that the film is actually a dream that Charlie has while awaiting being sent off to the front.There is plenty of slapstick via the Limburger cheese being used to gas the enemy, and Chaplin's foray into enemy territory dressed as a tree.By this stage in this career, the great man had become so immersed in filmic expression that his films give the impression of making themselves.

She is the most ridiculous human on the entire planet.

Even after nearly 20 years apart , the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing . In fact they've gotten better , and in some ways they've been better since the original band split. Black Sabbath is the original heavy metal band and their most successful album is still their best selling album. When Black Sabbath reunited they were the most popular band in the world. However, they had gone on several years without a new album or a tour. During this gap Black Sabbath broke up. But then they reunited and made an even better album than they did before.

A very weird , psychedelic , esoteric , ( and did I say weird ? : ) experience.But on at least a handful of occasions , I have wondered if the universe really does have meaning , if there is a meaning in life and if we could find it in a dream. This is one of the weirdest but most profound of my life, I feel it will be a part of who I am . It has been an enlightening experience and a great journey for me. I had this dream a lot in the week before and the dream has been going on all week .

Gary Busey's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography. Since had a musical background, he was able to do his own songs and it really works. It's always good to see that fine actor, Don Stroud (one of the crickets) and Charlie Martin Smith as well.An 8 out of 10. Best performance = Gary Busey. Thankfully, Mr. Busey was Oscar-nominated for this, losing to Jon Voight in COMING HOME. A fairly low-budget flick that doesn't disappoint, with GREAT SONGS by Mr. Holly. I hope this made plenty of dough.

I 've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer , and I 'm very excited to finally have the opportunity to see it myself. It is such a simple story, which makes it all the more compelling, and if I may put it out there: not very well made. There's not a whole lot to like about the flick itself, but I find it very difficult to judge on its own merits, and that's perhaps the biggest reason I feel inclined to post this review.

This is one of the best of the early `` Star Trek '' episodes , with Kirk and his crew doing a good thing. It's the second to last episode in a five season run and, while it has its moments, I didn't feel like it was any more than average. And I don't feel that way about the next two, either. When I first watched "Encounter at Farpoint , " as it was called in the syndication guide book, it was a revelation . I thought it was better than the movie, but I was never impressed with it myself.

What I enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of Corfu , being Greek I adore my country and its culture but the most beautiful and scenic place I have ever seen is Corfu and that film made me feel at home like it was my second home. I also like the idea of being a young boy and going with my mom and sisters to see my grandparents house at a very old family home and then being a teenager and having to go live with my father, his father and other brothers and sisters.

I agree that this is ONE of the very best episodes of the entire series--my only detraction would be the somewhat jarring appearance of Mark Lenard as the Romulan Commander. My reasoning is this--if you were not around for the first run of this episode, then you know Mr. Lenard as Sarek, Spock's father. And for the 2nd generation Trekkie (or Trekker--your preference) it takes you out of the scene at first. Yet he's an excellent commander as well as opposite for our captain and this episode is strongly written and well-acted by all.

i did not read the book. nor do i care to. the movie was a beautiful romance, and i think women will enjoy it. no, it was not a "10" film, but it was enjoyable. women, if your man is bored as mine was, then watch it yourself. hurt is wonderful as the philosophic doctor who delivers a thoughtful monologue on "in love" and "loving. "also, if you like nick cage, he was terrific and funny. i enjoyed watching the developing romance. also, if you like Christian bale -- do see him in equilibrium.

No . I 'm not kidding with this one . He was a guest reviewer for Entertainment Weekly and gave us his own personal opinion of the series and the show in general . I’m going to cut him right down the middle: he gave it 4.5/5, which is about what you’re supposed to give a show . And it’s worth your time. I think the big difference for me is I didn’t have time to watch The Sopranos when it started. And I don’t care for the show.

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family 's journey from the Old World ( Italy ) to the New ( America ). It is the story of the immigrant's journey to becoming American and the life they live in America. I have been looking for a new place to settle for years. I've tried to move away from home, and back to my roots, but have had problems with both. I have a close friend who is very supportive of my moving to a new place, but it would require a lot of money and would mean a complete upheaval in my life.

Wow , What a wonderful film-making ! Mr. Im has done it , again ! His last work , ChunHayang , was one of the best films that I've seen in years , in fact , I would have rated it very highly , as a whole , and I am still a fan of his work . In this film , though , he seems to have a new found love for the style of acting , and it appears to have been inspired in the same way as his previous films . The acting was quite good , especially for a foreign-film-actor-type , but this was more of an acting piece .

The movie is incredible , it has a sound track which sets the tone for the movie . THe lines are memorable and you can tell right away the film will be a hit. It makes you want to see it again and again . The cast is fantastic , they give you an idea of what you'll be getting into as they take you on a trip through history. If you have seen the movie a couple of times you'll know the basic plot . It's a fun ride and if you haven't seen the movie , this would be a great opportunity to go and see it.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something, and who appreciate a farce that is clever enough for you to take it seriously, this movie will surprise you. It is not a 'whodunit' for people who can't aren't able to follow the verbal exchange of our hero, Professor Dexter Cornell (Dennis Quaid).Cornell teaches in Southern California, near the tar pits. He has not published a novel in four years, his wife is divorcing him, he drinks a bit much, and is blessed or cursed with caustic wit, which he freely dispenses to his students.

The movie doesn't take itself seriously, and if you follow its lead you're going to have a lot of fun (as long as you don't mind your murders served up really bloody, and your horror topped with extra cheese)!This film winks an eye at every horror fan, and then gives them the finger. It knows it sucks, and because of that, it's far and away the best of the "Child's Play" series. It plays up the "stoopid humor" angle so well, you find yourself doing more than just laughing AT it, but WITH it.

Great movie . Post-apocalyptic films kick ass . This one is no exception . Kept up the pace and interest throughout the whole thing . This was more of a slow build than a bang-bang-bang action fest . What an awesome ending to this movie . The acting was top-notch all along , the special effects were great . The only nitpick i had was that I thought it would have worked better if there was an extra scene at the end with everyone on the way to their new home . Overall i would recommend this to any and everyone . 5 Stars .

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year. You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, and Court TV can be relied on for a few every weekend. So I started watching The Morrison Murders thinking I knew very well what to expect: a more or less competent retelling of a real-life family murder. What I got was a subtle, beautifully acted drama that engrossed me from start to finish.Both the brothers were totally convincing, and Jonathan Scarfe was perfect in the challenging role of Luke. The look and feel of Georgia was in almost every frame.

This is what movies should aspire to . Funny without being totally stupid , a little sexy without having every scene in the book , but with a great deal of intelligence and a healthy sense of humor. I had a great time watching this movie. It was funny, sexy and a great time to watch. It will be hard for anyone to beat the chemistry of this movie. If you're looking for a good comedy movie that's not just a comedy, and not just something that's just a mindless sex comedy , check this out.

These critics need to find a new job!!! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY, which has made history. It illustrates beautifully how even in the mist of war and tragedy love can conquer all. The breathtaking Chephallonia of Greece has captured my heart and soul as if I too were there. The Blue eyed Cage & the delightful Cruz were amazing! Together they perfectly portrayed how a Mediterranean couple can only become closer in the time of war. This movie will touch your heart like it did mine you must go see it!!! !

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner 's mansion in Paris. Duchess, who is a very talented musician, plays the piano and the violin beautifully. This video shows her amazing talents! She loves playing the piano in the living room of her owner’s residence in a big mansion in Paris, while her three kittens sleep. Duchess is a white cat with a white spot on her chest, and a black eye from being hit by a car! After playing a few minutes, her owner calls her name and goes to get her a bowl of food.

I'm not going to go into too much depth, but Showtime was a pretty funny movie. There wasn't any slapping-your-knee funny scenes (that I can remember), but it had it's moments. The cast is pretty good, Robert De Niro is good as usual and Eddie Murphy pulls off a pretty funny performance. Rene Russo was just fine in the film, no complaints there. There were two characters in the story that I liked that they didn't explain much at all. The first one was Trey Sellars' (Eddie Murphy's) buddy at the gym played by Ken Campbell.

The Aristocats is really quite charming, and is rated far too low on IMDb. The songs aren't as memorable as the ones in the Jungle Book, but they weren't bad at all. The animation is really lovely, the best sequence being the landscape of Paris in general. It looked beautiful. This is probably Disney's most relaxing animation I think, and as another reviewer quite rightly said, who doesn't love cats? Another great piece of animation was O' Malley looking into Duchess's eyes, as their romance was so believable while not obvious.

First off , I absolutely loved this movie . As a Billy Crystal fan , I must say that I loved the performance of Crystal and the story he wrote . The only thing that I didn’t like at all was that the movie took way too long for me to watch it. It was about 8 hours of me waiting for Billy Crystal to take off his clothes and get naked in front of me . The only thing I like is that when Billy did finally take it off, the music in the background made me want to see him take off everything else as well .

I 've commented once on this Chucky great , but I had to do it again to say some things about him to his supporters and friends. When I did this , I was attacked with hate mail, threats, and insults, all saying that I wasn't worthy to speak the truth of who I really am. I hope that I am speaking the truth about Chucky, because he did a great job and created a great story, and did a great thing for children that have no one to show them love and acceptance.

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house. It's a very positive and happy type of music. The movie has some sad parts but mostly the music is what makes me happy. Gary Busey did a great job as Buddy Holly. Buddy Holly kept on going even tho his pastor, his parents and the Nashville record producer told him no. Buddy Holly didn't give up on what he liked. I didn't know much about Buddy Holly until I watched this movie.

The success of SCREAM gave birth to a whole new horror flicks wave. I'm happy with that, as a big fan of horror, and I liked most of those new horror films. BOC is a one big pack of horror. Colorful, fast paced and original. I see this movie more like the opening of a new trilogy (much like Episode 1 and Aliens: Resurrection) since it comes up with a new twist. Instead of focusing on the little boy-killer doll relationship we have here a twisted movie about couples. We have the sweet young lovers in contrast with the killer crazy doll-sized lovers.

The last film by underrated director Alberto De Martino ("The Antichrist", "The Killer is on the Phone") is a truly suspenseful but incomprehensibly neglected giallo, containing pretty much all the trademarks that makes this Italian horror sub genre so magnificent and addictive to the fans. There are some very disturbing themes (child abuse, phony priests), loads of creepy moments, plot twists left & right, outstanding music and  last but not least  a handful of really sadistic murder scenes! Especially the opening sequence, which is some kind of prologue, is a powerful piece of horror!

Jack , Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond . His traumatic past experience of the White Whale has left him a bit shell-shocked, unable to cope in normal human ways. The survivors learn of a possible solution, a ship called the USS Enterprise, in the distance, but in order to take it, they need a boat. With no other option, they have to row across the open waters, in the middle of a storm. There’s no one to blame for this predicament, as we all get caught up in what we find ourselves to be doing.

I first saw "Signs of Life" on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation. It's a wonderfully written, ensemble production with terrific performances by Michael Lewis as Joey and Vincent D'Onofrio as his brother, Daryl. Arthur Kennedy, in one of his last roles, is also excellent as an aging shipbuilder whose family business is about to close. The rest of the cast which includes Beau Bridges, Kathy Bates and Mary-Louise Parker give remarkable clarity and substance to their characters.The direction is subtle and effective. I've watched this movie several times over the years and would very much recommend it.

Then again , I like Rachael Ray . She is fun , sweet , fresh , and such a joy for the kids . I wish I could be like that all the time . So when I am really bored , and I have to work , and my kids have no one to entertain them , I play games on the internet . I try to keep up with everyone , and I have a good time . . . . . . . . . But recently I have decided I have to go back and re-evaluate what I have on my “ To do ” list .

I just had the opportunity to see 'Nuovomondo' (hitherto known in the U.S. as 'The Golden Door'), and was very impressed by both it's dreamy & occasionally surreal tale of a family that immigrates from Sicially to the U.S. in the early days of the 20th century. It also worked as a (proverbial)middle finger jammed into the eyeball of Homeland Security (preferably all the way up to the 3rd knuckle),in it's depiction of the ill treatment of foreigners who just want a better life than they were getting from their original mother land.

As far as I know I've seen most of Lucio Fulci's films, with the exception of some later ones that are popping up on DVD now, and I would have to say this was his best "pre-zombie" offering. In fact it beats out his later movies hands-down. This is a tale of superstition and suspicion in a small Italian town out in the middle of nowhere, where young boys are dying mysteriously. It's no mystery how they died, I guess, it's more who's doing it. Is it a woman that the townspeople have always considered a witch?

This is probably my favourite TV show ever . I love all the characters , especially Alex , who is my favourite . I don’t think there are that many shows that have Alex in it . She has an interesting life . I also love how the show was written and directed . All the actors were fantastic . I think the first thing that I remember about the show is the song that was on every single episode . I thought that this is a show where you just sit quietly and read the words .

When his elderly mother Emily ( Jeanne Bates ) is attacked by her lodger Nestor Duvalier ( Brion James ) who is hiding in her house. She tries to save him, but he has a lot of money on him, and a lot of guns, which he intends to use as a weapon to get rid of Nestor. Cast       
 Brion James as Nestor duvalier   
 Jeanne Bates as Emily duvalier, Nestor's mother  
 Josephine Barrs as Clara Duvalier

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life , the action was great , and i really enjoyed watching all of the action . I would defenitely watch this film again and i will go out of my way to see it . I would definately go out of my way to see this movie one day , but not to see it again . I would have to go see it a third time . Okay this is the best film in a very long time, and not just that, it's the best movie ever made, no doubt, and it's one of my favourites.

As an English teacher, I appreciate films that do more than tell a story. Good films, like good literature, cause one to think, reflect and predict. This film made me do all three. Mr. Jansen takes risks and uses foreshadowing, symbolism and interesting turning points for many of his characters. I also likes the fact that despite the choices the characters make in the film, their choices do not seem as adolescent or felonious as other films I have seen. The acting is pretty good and the actors seem to share a good chemistry with each other.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen! The images that are shown are absolutely breathtaking and stunning. On top of that, it is a wonderful learning experience. I'm not one for educational documentaries, but this one grabs hold of you and doesn't let go until the end. You'll be so hooked and entranced by what you are watching that you'll forget your at home watching TV! This series is available to buy on DVD and I HIGHLY recommend picking this one up!

Due to its predictable , second-rate title , ( the one it was distributed under in Italy , at least) this game has always had trouble getting the attention it deserved. We’ve only seen the barest glimpses of it, mostly on Italian TV, and most of the time they’ve turned us off to it just a bit too quickly, or just before it was actually finished. The same problem afflicts so many games on our list, as the Italian version of this one is a prime example of this phenomenon.

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good . I have to admit Ms Cruz and I have never really bonded over politics. "Corelli's Mandolin has won Best Picture in two other categories. It was the runner up in both of those categories. It was not in the running for any other category, and neither was it nominated for any other category. In fact, it's the only category in which there were two nominees. I can think of only three films that have been so well-reviewed by critics in such a short span of time: Avatar, Avatar 2 and Avatar 3 .

I remember years ago BBC1 used to show this movie in a very cut form . I tracked it down and found some clips to watch, and then found a site that had a complete film on it on Youtube. If you watched the film a few times you will get it right. I remember when I was young, I watched the first few minutes and went 'what in the blazes' and then I had to watch the whole thing again. It just blew me away ! Here's the full film, but you have to pay a fortune for a DVD.

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II picked up and became a quite enjoyable watch for a couple of hours, from primarily two points of view. The love triangle is an interesting one and strikes me as believable, because I know it happened in various places under occupation. Penelope Cruz played Pelagia, a young Greek girl engaged to be married to Mandras (Christian Bale). I had questions about the depth of their love from the start, but their future was torn apart when Italy invaded Greece, and Mandras went off to fight.

Ah the Outer Limits . I love that show . It was surpremely creepy , or down-right mysterious . I always wondered what made those people think they could survive . But they did . . . . One interesting thing I noticed was that most people who survive the apocalypse are either from some form of military service or from a family line that is well established. One of the people who survived was a man who served in the US Army in Vietnam. His wife was a doctor and his father was a surgeon. I wonder if he would have survived if he had stayed out there?

This is a well directed Columbo episode , with also some good character but the story just does n't really connect to the rest of the series . All of the main actors are fine and are very good ,but there is a lot of background work to get to a point where they do connect in the end . The story is very well plotted , with great twists and some great twists . The acting is top notch and very well acted . There is a good twist to keep you going until the end (the ending is very unexpected and well written ) .

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos either. Ali G Indahouse is a hilarious laugh-a-second fun fest - just like on the small screen. He has lost none of his character or stupidity at all, and behind all that - none of the film is brainless fluff either. A human side to Ali is revealed during the film, the idea of Ali G running for PM is a brilliant, fresh and funny one - and the incessant stupidity of Staines' gangster man is mixed well with the stern, harsh world that is politics.

This movie got better with time. I can't believe that it has been forty years since I saw this at the age of 15. Yes, that's right. Movie ratings were not yet a reality, so any teenager could walk into any movie. Imagine what it was like for a kid my age to see both Midnight Cowboy and Putney Swope in the same year. Imagine the times. Bobby Kennedy and Martin Luther King has just been killed but the following summer had a man walking on the moon and Woodstock. Putney Swope was the Woodstock nation's chance to stick it to the man.

I think that this short TV series , was absolutely wonderful , and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of how life as a woman can be.
