There were a few things that were a bit too over the top to get away with , but I guess that I could understand why the show's writers felt that they had to, or else the viewer might get confused or irritated. So I was left with the feeling that this was a fantastic show that was worth the watch . I have watched it several time now and always find something that I missed the first time round.

By convincing the Prime Minister to back the totally unsuitable Ali G as a candidate for Staines in the local election, the Tories must be hoping that the Lib Dems will use their majority to take the seat from them. If the Lib Dems can't win in Staines, they will not be able to afford to lose any other seats at the next general election. The Conservatives have been able to get the better of Labour during the local election campaign in this election because Labour are not doing enough to get their policies through parliament.

Telling the story wouldn't be the point at all, would it? Barnens ö, spelled almost like "booné aww" is the title for that brilliant novel of the late seventies that shocked a lot of people, including myself.Children's Island is the title, and what an island. In the book, Raine, the main character has The Guiness World Record Book as his own Bible. And he's keen on breaking new records himself. In particular the youngest person under water for three minutes.The story is, as most Swedish films and books of the time, deep, consciously provocative and awe inspiring.

That this film flopped at the box office , and still struggles for the recognition it deserves today , is due mainly to the film’s lack of originality. There is, however, one major flaw in the film. If you look at the plot, and then add to it, a very simple but effective device which makes the film work. The movie is set in the era of WW2. It opens in Germany, and after two minutes the audience are thrown into the action. In this movie we see an English officer who has lost his son, in the war.

I watch tons of movies and had no idea this would be as good as it was . I was right and I have been to see it over and over . I saw it at the movie theater . I would like to buy a DVD copy , I did not see it at the midnight showing and would like to buy a DVD copy because I don't watch it all the way through . I saw it on DVD a few months ago and liked it as a whole , but not as a series . I saw the end and liked them as people , I thought they were great .

Telling the story would n't be the point at all , would it ? Barnens ö , spelled almost like 'barens' , probably derived from the Old English āpēn , which meant 'far' . In any case , the tale comes from a time when the sea was open and there was a fair trade in sea-farers' tales , and was an oral tradition , which was preserved and passed on down from father to sons , in the tradition of the tales told by Pwyll ap Einion, King of Dyved of the Mercians , who ruled from 627 to 629 . 1.

A Formula For Murder isn't a well known Giallo, but that isn't to say it's not a very good one! The film is directed by Alberto De Martino, the man behind cult classics such as The Antichrist and Blazing Magnums. The film was released late on in the Giallo cycle, but more than stands up to many of the films released around the 'golden' period in the early seventies. Despite a lack of logic in some areas, the film works mainly due to the competent way it mixes Argento style death scenes with some genuinely surprising plot twists, and a host of well defined characters.

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie (I have lived here my whole life), I have waited for this movie to come out. And I mean waited and waited and waited over a year and a half for this movie and to me, it was worth it.The movie is different from the book but in my eyes, it's still a beautiful piece of work as is the book. In both I cried, there were moments that tore me up. I laughed and I smiled just as much.

Considering it 's basically low-budget cast , this is a surprisingly good flick about the life and death of rock legend David Bowie , who died from a heroin overdose in November. The story focuses on the life of an aspiring musician named Bowie , who becomes the toast of his hometown of New York in the s . The plot is very much like the real story of David Bowie , but there are several twists and a few surprising plot twists that made this a fun movie to watch even if you know the real story from Bowie's life.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly ( 1936-59 ) . He does have a few odd habits in his movies that stand out from the crowd. Most people don’t bother with these things but they’re always there in a Busey film, which is one reason why Busey has been a favorite actor of mine since I can remember. He may not always have been good at being Buddy Holly – he could be annoying at times in some of his appearances – but he made his character very much his own.

OK , so this film may not have won any Oscars , but it is not a bad film . I would recommend it to anyone who loves horror or sci-fi . (Note: This review is from my review for the DVD, and my commentary from the DVD. The DVD will include both, but I do not recommend them together. There is no commentary for the DVD, but I will have a review on that soon. You may want to look at my review for the Blu-ray to understand why.) Let’s get some ground rules out of the way.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I've just managed to watch this film for the second time in nearly twenty years, and I can honestly say it hasn't lost any of its kick. I can't believe that Channel 4 have let this one vanish without a trace as it is an extremely powerful, moving and moralistic take on the consequences of misplaced loyalty. It focuses on a clique of friends over the course of ten years and their relationship with two 'outsiders' from school; specifically how they use one and mercilessly torment the other.

I think it definitely is. The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language should model their conversations after its dialogue. For example, the exchange between Paul Kersey(Bronson) and Ms. Kathryn Davis(Deborah Raffin) (more about this character later) is extremely clear and to the point: Ms. Davis says, "I hope you like chicken. It's the only thing I know how to make," to which Kersey deftly responds, "Chicken's good. I like chicken."

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old . I had no idea who he was at the time so my parents bought me a picture of him from the library. I was so entranced by that picture it was a long time before I thought to research him. When I finally found out more about him I thought he was absolutely fascinating and the story he was about, was so fascinating, that I couldn't believe it had taken me so many years to appreciate it. I was introduced to the story of Buddy Holly and the music that he grew up to become.

I remember this film of old. It's a great, chilling, atmospheric horror picture about a man who moves into a Scottish castle, only to discover that there are strange goings-on in the corridors at night. And there are even stranger events taking place out back, in Hollywood's most familiar hedge maze. Yes, this is the maze you've seen in every feature-length film that ever involved a topiary puzzle, up to and including "The Shining." But the punchline to this story is about the last thing you would guess. I certainly didn't see it coming.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people . The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of middle age have always fascinated me. There are so many different people from different walks of life and from different cultures who have made such a rich journey, and in doing so have provided so much inspiration to me in my life. This film beautifully portrays the journey of middle age in an entertaining way. The acting, direction, writing and performances are all wonderful. The movie has been released in a limited release and I highly recommend it for you.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans . Okay I 'm sure it 's not as good as the original, it doesn't show the Chucky from the first film but it does give a different side of him as a good father who tries to be a great father by giving his daughter an education and letting her live life to the fullest. I agree with the other reviewer who said this movie is pretty bad but I still thought it was entertaining and interesting. It's basically a Chucky film done as a comedy but I still enjoyed seeing him as an actual father.

These days , you rarely come by a kid 's show that does not involve 1 ) a preteen/teen pop star 2 ) an adorable child actor 3 ) some other pop star , or 4 ) a kid 's movie . There have been a handful of exceptions, but most kids shows these days have a lot of adult content (or none at all)

With the recent trend of kid's movies , there has been a lot of talk about kid 's movies with little or no kids involved. To my surprise, this is a trend that is not only continuing , but growing in popularity .

This is possibly one of my favorite films . It tells the tale of a girl named Gerda ( Chelsea Peretti ) who lives with her mother ( Lily Collins ) in a big house in Berlin. Gerda dreams of one day having a baby and has a secret plan to have a baby of her own. One day Gerda's mother is taken by the Gestapo because she was a member of a communist organization that was supporting the resistance to the Nazis. So when the Gestapo comes and takes her, Gerda's mother tells her daughter that she's going to marry the man they were looking for.

I absolutely adore this movie ! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store the other day , but I went out and bought it . I really like the way that the characters interact and I really enjoy how it has a different feel than most action movies. I recommend the movie to everybody ! I really enjoyed the first two thirds of the movie. I am not a huge fan of horror movies but this film had a unique idea that made me really intrigued to see what came next.

I 'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci 's films . Most of his 80s gore films had their share of camp value but it seemed to me that, with The Strain, he took a huge risk with his latest film. He did what so many other film directors try to do and went for something totally different from what is normally done in this kind of genre. It was very different from anything he has ever done before. The film started well and I thought that was going to be enough to get people talking but I couldn 't help but to think, 'what if he 's doing something right?

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it. It is just not available and it has not been on TV for many many years. I enjoyed it and the songs because it had something different to say and made you think how every person looks at something from different prespectives. Also we often don't appreciate something we have till it is no longer there.My 12 year old daughter just discoverd the music and is entranced with some of the songs. Someday I hope to get a copy of the film so she can have an opportunity to view it.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004 's Academy Awards , My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to discover the secrets behind one of New York City's most notorious criminal architects. After an intense investigation of Kahn's career, we see the young artist struggle with the past and his present, as he attempts to reconnect to his roots and to the man who saved his life by giving him a new beginning. The film was originally intended to be directed by the late Michael Radford and featured in a feature length documentary about New York City, but it was never made in its entirety.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something , and who appreciate a farce that is cleverly designed , let us all take a walk back in time with this story from the 1950’s and the early 60’s. Here are some quotes from the film and some quotes from the book. From the novel, "The Day The Earth Stood Still," the first quote is in paragraph 1 of the opening chapter. When I first saw him, I felt a sudden rush of love for the man, who in my eyes was a hero, a man I admired, envied and respected.

Saw the film at the closing gala of the Ealing Film Festival in West London ( England ) . Enjoyed it . .Enjoyed it . Saw it last week. It is now on DVD. There was one minor problem I found with it . There is a long shot of a family with the kids in matching t- shirts . At the end, as they are exiting the theater, it shows one of the little girls wearing a T shirt with an American flag, and there is another American flag t shirt on the father. The American flag is on both shirts.

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters. I had never heard of it when it appeared on cable. After the first shock of realizing this is not like any other movie you have seen since Bringing Up Baby you have to let it sweep you along and run with it. Not until it's over do you realize it covers issues that are not only subtle but significant. Alienation, denial, wish-fulfillment, for a start. Cathy Bates owns this movie, she's never been better.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful place in the annals of horror film history. His style of filmmaking has had many admirers over the years, from Robert Rodriguez and Quentin Tarantino to Wes Craven and John Woo. Fulci is the author of several books himself, including a collection of short fiction and essays. The following excerpts from the recently released posthumous The Best of Lucio Fulci reflect on the filmmaker's life and work, and in doing so, shed light on his unique style of filmmaking and his unique approach to cinema history and aesthetics.

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments on earth. The video starts out with these beautiful underwater photos of the Great Barrier Reef which is also one of the top 10 tourist attractions in the world. From this we go to a short film on how coral reefs are dying off and being overfished by commercial and recreational fisheries. In this film we can also learn about what can be done about these threats and the best way to do it. These types of films should be mandatory viewing for anybody interested in the health of coral reefs.

This version of "The Lost Horizon" is actually not a bad film at all. I think the problem is people like to pick on musicals, especially those made in the 70s. I saw the film upon its original release in 1973 (I was ten) and really enjoyed it, the music especially. (Burt Bacharach has always been a favorite.) The story is fun, the acting is good, and technically it's excellent. Sure, there are one or two rather silly dance numbers, but hey, you can't win 'em all.

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie. I caught it last night on TMC. I thought it was hysterical. I laughed so hard and loved the ending. Image what a Marx brothers movie would like if they collaborated with Salvadore Dali and Malcolmn X and then all dropped LSD.Funny and edgy are two overused words these days, this movie sure has that plus about 200 IQ points of most comedies today and surrealistic to boot. I had to be up at 6:00 am and watched it until 2:30. I over slept and missed my obligations. Still worth it.

It's up there with Where's Poppa, The Groove Tube, Putney Swope. It memorializes the NY city mind set of the period, a wonderfully strange man with a bizarre plan, hoist by by own petard, and at last retreating into the bed of his adoptive parents. Totally absurd, its the life one sees through the magic glasses, seeing things as they "really are"... I don't think it is ever shown anymore. If so, surely someone would Tivo the thing and put it out there.

All the characters in this cartoon were hilarious. Norman the Viking guardian had some memorable phrases and the skull master, the bad guy, would always be vowing to kill Max with some insane cackling. The writing is the best. I was glued to the set when this would come on when I was younger. If they came out with a DVD of all the episodes they made I would be forced to buy it. This and a Conan the Barbarian cartoon are the ones I miss the most from childhood. I think these cartoons are the most unappreciated out of all the great cartoons.

Charles Chaplin 's 'Shoulder Arms ' of 1918 was his longest film to date , though , at just over two hours, the length of a standard feature film , it was hardly a full feature . It is, however, an essential document of the silent cinema, and is, in fact, Chaplin's first film in full colour . It also contains the single, most famous, and certainly most popular shot in film . This is an image from the film, and a single frame, in full colour , of Chaplin .

When I was 10 ( currently 14 ) , I vowed to never see a movie that I knew would be bad , I wanted to be the only person who enjoyed the film . it was the same for a lot of these movies , just that I was able to get a handle on what I thought , so I didn't know how bad the movies were , until I saw them . some films are just like that , you never know how good or bad they were , as long as you enjoyed the ride , it doesn't really matter .

I love this movie , though I do n't like how they picture Egyptians , being an Egyptian citizen myself. Thats just not right. I mean, if you have a lot of experience traveling around Egypt , you can not be a foreigner in Egypt at all. I think this movie just wanted to make Egypt into a country that's so big , there's no need to have any type of foreign population in the country. Just like America has a lot of people , I believe Europe has a lot of people , too. That's just how people like to see it .

This is a 100% improvement over the dross of a third movie and it's one hell of a good time. This is a John Hughes movie meets The Devil's Rejects. I really enjoyed this movie and it really stands out as the savior of the series. I thought Jennifer Tilly played Tiffany really well and Brad Dourif in Chucky's shoes once again really makes this movie shine. Actually they're the only good parts of the movie. I got rather bored with Katherine Heigl and Nick Stable's scenes. It's as if they were thrown in there as a sidetrack and someone to save the day.

I usually give horror films around 6/10, but this one caught my eye. House of Wax was by far the best horror film I have seen... Even better than the Amityville Horror.Paris Hilton was quite good in this and I must say, has a good future ahead. Her death scene was probably the coolest. I'll just say how she dies...She gets a giant pole right between her eyes and they close-ups on and everything. Gory, eh? Brian Van Holt was very good as both the killers, Bo and Vincent (Vincent had the long hair).

This is one of Chaplin 's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more ambitious productions he made for Selznick from 1927 until 1932, when he moved to the studio he would own, United Artists, during the war. It was also one of Chaplin's first screen collaborations with Stan Laurel, the man he hired as his assistant in 1929 to produce his own shorts and to assist him in many of his films of the time, notably _City Lights_ (1930). Chaplin makes two great contributions to the story here.

I just thought I would add another observation , here . While there are a couple of visual sub-references , there are also very few in the text that can be compared directly with the sub-references . There are also some more specific references that have more in common with the visual content . And the most important of these are the following . While it is obvious that the visual content should be taken into account even more , there is a second aspect that is much more important . There is a relationship between the visual and the textual content . We will discuss this second aspect in a bit more detail later.

When I first saw this movie,I also expected "our boys" to be cute,and more like an extended version of the TV show. I didn't "get it" back then. But,years later,at a party YEARS later,at a 70s' type PAR-TAY,where certain substances had been smoked,inhaled,and with plenty of tequila,"HEAD" was on late at night.We watched it,and finally realized what "HEAD" was all about. It spoofed their own show,as shown in one song that called themselves,"a manufactured image".

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments on this planet. Being a staggering five years in the making, one would be hard-pressed to expect any less. I did get the impression that some scenes from the first episode where repeated in the latter ones, which is naturally only a minor gripe.David Attenborough is great as a narrator and comments are informative, leaving enough room for one's imagination, and well spaced out, so that viewers get plenty of time to reflect upon the breathtaking imagery.

This searing drama based on a true incident concerns several ambitious African nationals who decide to temporarily leave their families and embark on a trip to the United States. Once they have arrived, however, they begin a search for the perfect American woman who will help them achieve their American dreams. The film’s most notable achievement is the skill with which it manages to humanise all of its characters, from the young men who dream of finding “The One” through their mothers and fathers, to the African women who will be tempted to leave their own country for the chance of a better life.

The best thing from the American Pie "bakery." I found the humor and the plot to be far more engaging audience than any of the American Pie movies to date. .Also concerning the appropriateness of the content I found this to be acceptable to a much larger audience than any of the previous American Pie movies. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie experience. When the movie first came out I read a number of negative reviews and ended up not going to see it while it was still in the theater...I now regret that decision.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it. I found the storyline very distressing and can still remember the various bullying techniques used. One in particular was when the other school children spat in his soup before he could even taste a spoonful. They also bound him and shaved his private parts. This was all because he was unpopular. Why was he unpopular? Because he was bad at games. I have a feeling though that even if he was good at games he would have been bullied because it's hard to decide what makes someone popular.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange . I was confused , sad , and a little mad at how the main characters behave , then i realized that the movie was a love story in disguise . It was a true emotional film that i loved and watched in one sitting and that i recommend to you if you feel lonely like me , or if you feel that life is a big joke to you and you need someone to love and comfort you . Enjoy it . It was an emotional and beautiful story.

It was a terrific movie! I like to watch it again and again. The actors were awesome. The movie kept me on the edge of my seat. I would recommend this movie to anyone. I wish Lifetime would put this movie on DVD. I would most definitely purchase a copy. This movie just proves that you should be very careful about who you get hooked up with. You may think you know someone, but you never know. My daughter watched the movie with me. She thought it was great. All I know is, I will watch this movie every time Lifetime airs it.

I saw this film at the Seattle International Film Festival in a full house of avid movie buffs and Indian ex-pats. The film is amazingly beautiful and smooth flowing for a first film. The direction is self assured, especially with locals who were recruited on the fly for extras and bit parts. While the plot and story line is elementary to nonexistent, the pleasures of watching the performances and scenery offset the lack. The soundtrack to this film is a big attraction to world music lovers. If you want to see what can be done in 45 days, with a different location every day, check out Hari Om for inspiration.

I Loved this movie. Mark Blankfield was perfect for this role. More Classic sci/fie/Horror films should be remade to this comedy level, which is at the very top of the line in my opinion. A no drink movie, you laugh so hard you will spill it all over yourself. Can We expect more? Let's hope so. I would like to suggest many movies for this type of remake. Mel Brookes made some remakes of classic films.He made some very strong contributions. A Picture of Dorian Gray would be a good suggestion.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie . But really all the characters are amazingly fun to be around and this movie is definitely a must see in theaters . The main stars and actresses are all super hot as is . I will not say more about this movie but I will say that it is a hot movie to see . The movie starts with a great story that you will not want to miss this movie . This is definitely a film to watch for sure . A very sexy and fun film .

An interesting look at the immigrant experience , told as a fable with some very weird imagery.I got drawn to this book because I have been fascinated by the way immigrants and non-immigrants have responded differently to being displaced. I think the way it is written that is a very important and important point to think about when analyzing the experience of being a displaced migrant. The fact that this story is presented with this weird imagery made me more intrigued. I am not saying this is good literature by any stretch of the imagination. In fact, I believe this book is pretty awful.

it's a great movie for the whole family. i don't think many people have seen it cause i ask people and they say that they've never heard of it before. Sophie Heyman is my aunt's sister in law. my favorite scene is the whole movie i can't even pick a favorite scene. my favorite character is Hubert because he is a funny yet smart dog. if someone hasn't seen it they are missing out on a great adventure. i've only seen it cause my aunt is related to Sophie and she got a copy from her.

I first saw The Victim (aka Out Of Contention) well over 25 years ago when I was very young. Being a passionate fan of Bewitched since I was a child, I loved to watch anything that starred Elizabeth Montgomery. This movie was (and still is) a real treat - whether you are a fan of Miss Montgomery's work or not. Elizabeth always shines in her roles, such as her portrayal as the rape victim in A Case Of Rape and as the suspected murderess in The Legend Of Lizzie Borden.

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I 've seen in a very, very, very, very long while. I've seen this a number of times over the past 8 years and I'm in a state where I need a good laugh. I saw it at a theater with a friend and that was the first movie of the evening. I was on the verge of going to bed. I was very excited. I'm not sure exactly how to explain what I'm thinking here.

WTF!! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending?? The Notebook was good...but sheesh, enough with the depressing endings already. I'm told that he writes about realistic situations that people deal with in real life. Understandable...but sometimes it's nice to see people who have sacrificed their whole lives to only get to a mediocre unhappy time in their lives - to finally find the true meaning of happiness and are able to live it out for the rest of their days. Don't we already know what really happens in real life?

My favorite show of all time ! Yeah , I thought this was so cool , and Larisa Oleynik was my favorite . I was soo glad they used her in this . You can see a little of her when she was still a young teen in the commercial ! This is the show I've never watched but I've always wanted to ! I really like this show , it was very original , and the music was great , not too hard rock , not too soft . I enjoyed it . It's a really good show for the family , but it is not for the hard rock crowd .

I 've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months ( maybe longer but not much ) and it is the best show on tv right now. It is not only the funniest show on tv, but the most honest and realistic tv show out there. When people tell me to make more people laugh I say, "I can only make so much , and if that is all you want then go watch something else. But give me a reason to laugh, or else you do not get my attention".

Like a few people I know , I came in late on 'Stingers ' ; not until 2000 . Three years later, I sat down with this wonderful band and began making the trek across the country. I went out to see them for the first time, in their first studio recording, a live set at the Ritz in San Francisco in May 2000 , the day before their first tour date . I was a little late, but then again, they weren't . I got to see them play, and I knew I had to go to the shows.

Enchanting . The best time to see this movie is sometime when unhappy or sad . It 's all just so very charming . I enjoyed watching the movie . All of the actors played their roles well . I 'd give this movie . . . 9 out of 10! Lovely movie , I thought the movie was a very good one . And it's a very romantic movie . The only thing that can be improved is to make the love part more lively and more real . But if it's like this it's a really good movie .

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the supporting roles to the foursome of lies and intrigue. Yet at the heart of it all, each character maintains a streak of decency - moral conscience held up in spite of obvious contradictions. "Contradictions are the source of all movement and of all life." How true these words are. Watson's Anne Manning is at the core of this intrigue - she's the central conscience that the other three latched on. She is the decency undeterred.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I 've ever seen . Not only it 's very well directed, acted , scripted and executed but it's also the best movie I have ever watched in terms of visual and sound design, acting and atmosphere . I think I've been watching it more times than any movie . I'm not sure whether this is the reason or not . The movie is great. The acting is good, the visuals are excellent. The story is not bad. The plot twists are awesome and unpredictable. The music and score are awesome.

I thought that the storyline came into place very well . I liked this movie a lot . If you like action movies this is one of the movies for you . The acting is good and there is no one who is out of place . The cinematography and music were awesome . The stunts were real and impressive . I liked this movie a lot but I found the acting in it was a bit boring . I thought the plot was good and I was happy with it but I felt that the acting was a bit bland and it felt like this was just filler for the plot line .

I don't see that much wrong with this movie. Granted, the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti and Maria Callas, but they can certainly carry a tune. Burt Bacharach and Hal David are talented songwriters and I happen to love their songs, especially "The World Is A Circle", "The Things That I Will Not Miss", and "Question Me An Answer". Some people claim that Hermes Pan's choreography is ghastly and that the snowy mountain sets look as if they were made of plastic; I disagree on both counts.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos, it's just that we haven't seen as much of him as we used to. After his role in ‘Bend it like Beckham,’ I wondered how he was going to adapt into a bigger film role. Well, turns out he's very good at adapting and playing a bit part that has a similar look to his big screen roles - and in a much bigger way. So how’s this one coming along?

Before I forget, let me say the artwork in here is outstanding. From garbage cans to the huge cruise ship, the drawings are beautifully done. If this wasn't animated, critics would be lauding the "direction" in here, because it's really good.To the story: Sylvester is picking through the garbage at the shipyards but the pickins' are slim. While brooding at the dock next to a big ship, in a porthole he spots Tweety in his cage. Tweety spots him, too, and you know his first comment - the same one he always makes when he spots the cat.

This is one of the best sequels around and a very good movie too even there were some mistakes but the plot is very well told. The story is a simple but very good one that I enjoyed. And I have seen many bad ones of the same kind. And this is one of them. But I must say that this sequel is far superior than the first. The first part was good in a way but the 2nd is really bad. The bad part of this is that the script of this sequel does not suit the story.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre . Set in Rome in the '50s, the plot centers around a priest who is killed in an apparently senseless murder. However, the killer is one of his flock, and he uses his power to get what he needs . The film is not nearly as bad as its reputation. It's a fun film with a great script and some great performances. Director Fulci also wrote, produced, and co-directed this film, along with cinematographer Sergio Castellitto.

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I've seen in a while. It's an emotional roller-coaster. One of my favorite scenes is the pub scene. When Dirk tells Grace that he didn't want to go to the pub because the villagers don't like him, you expect the worst. When the old woman holds her glass up and says 'To the Memory of Victor Fox and the whole pub follows suit, I wanted to cry. The funeral scene is hysterical! Julie does it in her typical Julie Andrews style. Johnathan Pryce is excellent as Victor.

In Tweety 's S.O.S , Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that takes him to the Grand Canyon . The movie is about learning to survive on his own. The film adaptation of Sylvester plays out on a cruise ship for the better part of a year, where Sylvester is thrown into life on the boat without knowing where he is or who is around him. He tries to find some stability and direction, and to find someone he can be comfortable with on this new adventure. So how does the movie handle the question of survival?

1930 's comedy mystery about `` The Crooked Circle '' a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the destruction of a small town and a man's career. 1935 's musical-comedy movie, "The Wizard of Oz," is set in Emerald City, which is the home of the wizard, Glinda, and her helpers. 1942 A film adaptation of Rudyard Kipling's famous novel, ''Kim,' is based on this novel. 1947 The first picture to be released under the title ''King Kong'' was shot at Grauman's Chinese Theater in Hollywood.

Barbora Bobulova 's portrayal of Valeria in this story was entirely captivating and heart wrenching at the same time .I love the character of Valeria as she is strong but also sweet and gentle and a true friend to her and everyone who loves her . I also loved the way the characters interacted and acted as well .I would love to see a sequel to this story where this lovely lady will have her day in court and fight back against the evils that have invaded her life . I do hope that the story will see the light of day soon .

There's no point in comparing this with the original series. Though different in look and content, both are true to the original idea. That is, an SF/horror anthology series. Due to indifferent scheduling in Australia, I've only managed to catch a small number of episodes spread over the first few seasons. The very first episode really did give me the creeps (nightmares at my age ...!) but a number of others did fall flat; generally when the stories moved into horror realms and away from SF. I only hope the DVDs reach us eventually.

At first I did n't think I would like this movie , but as it progressed it became better and better. I thought it was really well written , not too long and the story flowed from one to the other very well. It was written in a very smooth manner and could have been cut out more , but I understand this is a movie that has to make you think about it for the time that you are there, so it is hard to do. One thing I did not like about the movie , is the ending.

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci 's reputation as a director . Too often he 's regarded by horror movie lovers as a horror auteur , but a good deal of the films he 's made would have been made much more successfully by someone far less talented than himself. The films I think best illustrate this are his earliest, such as Death Trap and The Cenotaph, but it's hard to think of other films that aren't quite as memorable (or at least far better remembered) as The Beyond, The Reptile, or The House of Torment, all of which he also wrote.

Can the intensity of a husband 's love for his wife lead him to cover up a crime , despite the obvious consequences to her and to himself ? Can a wife's jealousy lead her to seek out an affair to destroy the man who caused her great distress ? These and other questions about marriage and jealousy are raised by a remarkable new book, 'The Perfect Wife,' by Susan W. Smith. A journalist who has covered the news, Smith takes us on an adventure of a kind that is rarely told in the family or in the home.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat ! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the cast in the film, the stars are on show and the fun is starting. I think it's fair to say that there's a good chance that the film will go into production in February or March, but as with many of the other films in the project it's very possible that it may well go into production in early March or early April. The film is set to premiere in cinemas from March 1, 2015.

An old man is riding his bike down a village road when a car comes out of nowhere, strikes him down dead, and keeps driving. The rest of the film is spent discovering who hit him, why he was hit, and what consequences this murder will have on the rest of the village. Separate Lies is a very British movie indeed. I'm not saying that hit-and-run car accidents are a particularly British phenomenon, but the way everyone reacts to this tragedy is very British. Tom Wilkinson plays James Manning, a hard-working, respectable citizen with a "stiff-upper-lip" attitude towards tragedy.

The cover of the VHS says it all : `` Without doubt , the most powerful movie of its kind in years.`` I don't have much to add to that. And, if I may so express an opinion, I'd say that the movie is a pretty good watch -- it has an excellent cast, the script is well-crafted and the direction is terrific, and the movie is fun, even if it's not really all that gripping. I didn't see the movie on its initial release, however, so I can't speak to the movie in any great detail.

I thought it was brilliant ! It was great watching the presenter tracking each one of them down . Dwight was fantastic and made it all look so simple . It was great to hear them laugh about each other and the challenges in finding a job. It made you feel all warm and fuzzy inside. Great job by all of you for making it all happen and for making me feel like I'm not alone! I was really excited to be a part of this job and to see what it was all about and how great it was going to feel!

Valeria, an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and depression. Although she may have a one-night lover or if someone lives with her, it makes no difference of being completely alone. Valeria is also a passionate woman who can take actions to approach that special man, Massimo, and at the same time the fear that allows her to answer his questions only with a "yes", "no" or "I don't know". The way to accent the loneliness of the character is magnificent.

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans. Okay I'm sure it's not as good as what the Child's Play movie were like, but this can get really funny and enjoyable, Chucky's laughs are hilarious. (SPOILERS)Now not one doll, but two, meaning double the impact, Jennifer Tilly played the part really well and definitely pulled off the best kill of the movie.If you have seen the Child's Play movies this would be a worthy film on your Chucky collection, but if you've never seen the Child's play movies before, this'll will be a new start.

Oh I remember watching this show at 4:00 p.m. during my junior high days . It was not a pleasant experience, but I do remember thinking to myself I want to be one of them. I watched it again last night, and to my pleasant surprise it is actually a really funny show. In fact it has been on for over a year, and yet I still haven't watched any others. The only one that is on now is "The Simpsons" which I have just seen once. It is funny, but just not what I am going to watch.

This is one of the finest TV movies you could ever see . The acting , writing and production values are fantastic . It was filmed in black and white , and it is well worth the viewing . I think it would be an excellent film for the younger generation . There is an element of fear in the plot , but you get a good feel of what the world is like from the film . It was made in 1951 . I saw this movie with my daughter . She liked it a lot . It was the first movie that our family saw .

As many of today's movies are guilty of, the plot isn't exactly stellar, the movie doesn't move anyone, and certainly this won't warrant any award (outside of Blockbusters' perhaps)...but then again, who really cares.Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro team up to produce a very funny, at times hilarious, movie that I really enjoyed. Russo and Shatner played their small parts well as well. Man, I hope in the future my wife ages as well as Miss Renee has.Moving along, this "buddy" cop-flick produces high laughs in a reasonable amount of time.

People comparing this movie to big blockbusters like Lord of the Rings or the Matrix will inevitably be disappointed with the way this movie turned out. Although it lacks in the big special effects department and there are no battles with hundreds of extras, there is still a masterful amalgamation of two old folk tales here. The acting talent, although not A-list, is still great and the interaction between the characters is perhaps more sincere than in a larger movie with an A-list cast. My particular favourite from this movie is Bridget Fonda, whose performance as the Snow Queen herself was quite moving, assisted enormously by a stupendous wardrobe and makeup.

I viewed the original Outer Limits in real time, when first broadcast and have since viewed the entire original series again and again in re-runs and complete on DVD. I find the New Outer Limits WELL MORE than just a remake of old retread episodes, as some of the more adolescent commentators have suggested.With seven (7) years of programs versus just the two (2) years of the original series, the producers and writers have certainly added considerable new original stories and philosophical lines to a much longer running and very well produced (cable) TV series.

You know , people who make comedies so often forget it 's really ok to be outrageous . Well , that's us , right now , in a world full of outrageousness . And , we're trying to figure out where to go and what not to do . Saturday, September 29, 2013

Well , I always try and make sure I'm not being rude when I say , I love you , so , when I have the privilege to be asked to write an article , I feel very happy about that , because , I always try to make sure you know how I feel .

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of India. When was the last time you could say you really enjoyed a movie? This movie has pace and keeps us moving in directions that may only exist in India. If you didn't want to visit India before this movie will surely make you want to visit it now. This movie has dancing girls, a chase scene, and the mafioso involved. But it has a lot more. Thanks, Bharatbala, for taking us on such a spirited and wonderful tale.

The revelation here is Lana Turner's dancing ability. Though she was known privately to be an excellent nightclub and ballroom dancer, Miss Turner rarely got the opportunity to demonstrate this ability on film.So, viewers take notice! Here, MGM were clearly still trying to determine in what direction they would develop the still young starlet, and were, therefore, consigning her to everything from Andy Hardy to Doctor Kildaire.In "Two Girls on Broadway," however, she is given an excellent opportunity to display her native rhythm and ability to shift tempo in the lavish production number, "My Wonderful One, Let's Dance."

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a film? Probably someone. But no-one, truly no-one, could ever compare their expectations with the amazingly emotive and powerful performance given by the two actors in this film.Michael (Steven Robertson) lives in a home for disabled people. He has Cerebral Paulsy, and as shown to us right at the beginning, he has huge trouble communicating. So it truly is a lifeline when fellow disabled member Rory (James McAvoy) who can speak normally, understands him.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time. Top 20 of my lifetime. I laughed more than I have since Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, and cried more than I have since I saw The Notebook. If you are looking for a touching movie without the sappy edge...this is the one. It is real and powerful. See it and you won't regret it. I was reluctant at first and I only watched it because I had to do a school project about speech disabilities. But this movie is so much more than that.

Being American , I have not been exposed to this character before , which is good because some of you have no clue to what this is and I will try to explain . I will try to make it short and simple . Its about how you are going to have to change your life and start to live the American dream in order to make more money and not to have to pay your taxes . I think this is a very good article that can help people to change their life . Let's start with the main character .

i love this film!! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is talking about and means to do. it kept me laughing for the duration. duration of the film, the next day, and beyond. i think this film is not one to watch if you mainly care about the plot and character development. this film is pretty much only for the generation that will understand it. there are lots of things you just know being brought up in that generation that you wouldn't if you were say 40. i think Sacha barren Cohen was Very and i do mean Very good.

What a great film ! I never knew much about Buddy Holly , but was familiar with his lively and vibrant voice. I grew up listening to the Beatles , and was a big John Lennon fan . I always wanted Buddy Holly’s autograph , with the hope I might one day get it . After all , it took over 30 years for him to make his comeback . If I could give him a shout out in his name , I would like to give it to him : Buddy Holly for being a true icon . He will be forever remembered by many , including myself.

My favorite show of all time! Yeah, I thought this was so cool, and Larisa Oleynik was the first crush I ever had (AAAAWWWWWW). It was well written, funny-except when it it wanted to be serious, and just a great show overall. But since we couldn't afford to keep Nick, I couldn't see any episodes after Feb. 1996, and maybe that makes me think more of the show than I should. To me it's more the epidemy (now that doesn't look spelled right!)

After a somewhat slow start I thought this movie about the Italian occupation of a Greek island during World War II was the best in recent years. A group of British officers are taken on a secret mission involving a Nazi submarine on a voyage to attack a Nazi fleet off the coast of Egypt, but in an unexpected turn things take a turn for the worse. I would suggest watching this film with a small group. It is well acted but the movie does have some moments where the story can get confusing but that is not always the case in a film of this nature.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie . She was only 19 years of age when she had the career that she did, she is the only singer I know of who has made it to age 50 . She was the first singer I heard that had her own style that was so unique , so unique I can still hear the sound of the music when I close my eyes . I think this movie is the greatest motion picture ever made . I am not only talking about her singing or acting . I think its about her looks and style .

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful reputation as the "Godfather Of Gore". Fulci's absolute greatest film, however, dates back to 1972 and, while it is definitely gritty and violent, it is not nearly as gory as many of his other films. "Non Si Sevizia Un Paperino" aka. "Don't Torture A Duckling" of 1972 is not only by far Fulci's greatest film, this tantalizing and utterly brilliant Giallo is one of the absolute highlights of the genre.

Just exactly HOW director John Madden come to settle with Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz playing the roles of an Italian Officer and a Greek Villager in an honourable story: "Captain Correli´s Mandolin", just escapes me! Witness: a wobbly, inconsistent accent by Cage amid horrendous over-acting, with Cruz -- more adequately cast as a spoiled Latino opposite Johnny Depp in "Blow" -- in basically a repeat performance under the guise of a Greek nurse... ay, it was painful. But there were saving graces.The story itself is thrilling-to-tragic, and Cage does have some (-- redeeming, this is !--) musical ability.

"Caribe" is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects. However, it delivers a perfectly enjoyable story, along with a magnificent cinematography. The narrative structure is set around two narrative axes, one of them embedding the other, each one having elements that relate and co-exist in excellent harmony. The story never loses the right pacing, and it shows a very good blending of the human figure with its natural environment (which is a character in itself). The acting is great, and for that we owe credit to the emerging director, Esteban Ramírez.

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters in the late 1950s under the title "The Chaplin Review".This was an odd film in some ways because later in life, Chaplin was anti-war and his movies stressed peace and brotherhood. This film, in contrast, is a propaganda comedy meant to bolster the US efforts in WWI. It's truly odd to see Charlie as the "super soldier" who single-handedly captures 13 Germans, casually and coolly shoots several Germans in mere seconds as a marksman and then goes behind enemy lines to try to capture the Kaiser himself!

When I saw this film at a festival years ago I was very impressed and I started to looking for it again. So I saw this film again today and found it even better than the original. I really liked the film very much. I've also read the book so now I have two films in my hands. I recommend the film very much. I can't give you more than 10/10 but you'll have to see it to know that! I think you've made a great decision with this one. It has all the good qualities that you mentioned and then a few things in addition.

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary. I knew it was about an ex-Viet Nam POW in Laos who escaped, but I didn't know much else. In reality, I wasn't expecting too much. Oh what a surprise! The story of this man's life is very interesting in itself, but what sets this film apart from other biography-type docs is that Dieter himself tells most of the story himself. Dieter is very comfortable in front of the camera. His personality really shines. He tells his story about his life growing up in Germany during WWII and the hardships.

Made at the height of the Black Power movement, this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope (Arnold Johnson) getting made CEO of a corporation after the white CEO dies (the white executives all hate each other and can't decide who should succeed the previous CEO). Once in power, he decides to turn it into a militant organization.I don't know how Robert Downey Sr did it, but he did it! "Putney Swope" is the ultimate jab at America's power structure. It's the sort of thing that seems like it would have come out of Richard Pryor's mind.

i love this film ! ! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is trying to share with me. it is my favourite film ! and i will watch this again and again and again till the day i die ! ! ! ! This film has been one of my favourites. It is not one of the best films I have seen in my life and I would rate it lower than a 5. But it is a great movie. I would have loved a sequel with John Malkovich. He is perfect. A great film!

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative , but I loved this movie . I thought it was well done, I enjoyed it very much and I'm sure that the rest of the cast would have too. As far as the acting was concerned, I have to say it was the best casting I have ever seen on screen . I had a couple of favorites from the first ten cast members that I would not want them to not have their parts , and I would love for them to not be in my life .

I was n't expecting a great deal from this film , so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it . I'm not entirely sure what to think of it , but it seems to make sense in a kind of way . The film begins with an interview with two men in which one of them mentions that the film will have an ending where his wife dies . He asks the other man to promise him to let him see her before his death . I think this is a good way to end , I'm not entirely sure what to think about it .

I think this show was right on the money for me . I watched it over the plane but there was always time for other things. I just watched the latest episode. I must say I loved it. The show is one of the best dramas I have ever been in. I have only one problem though.. I don’t think it is really a romance drama. It is not like any other romance drama on tv. It’s a drama between two guys. You can’t take the show too seriously. It doesn’t have anything to do with sex.

Just as in "Columbo" we see the fatality occur right at the beginning. What follows is an escalating web of lies, sex, blackmail, and murder. The investigating officer, Adam Arkin, is even somewhat of a fumbler, not unlike "Columbo". It is William H. Macy, as the movie critic suspect who carries the film. Constantly twisting and turning, the plot sends Macy deeper and deeper into the quicksand of his "perfect crime". William H. Macy fans will enjoy "A Slight Case Of Murder", as will those who like crime capers with all kinds of delicious possibilities.

Little Dieter Needs To Fly is another in the remarkable body of Werner Herzog 's filmic work that is without a doubt on par with his best films: _Carnival_ (1982), _Aguirre, The Wrath Of God (The Inconveniencia del Greco), Nosferatu_ (1979) , and _Cries And Whispers_. The film opens with Dieter on a plane, waiting to take off. He sits on his throne, sipping his drink, staring out the window as he talks on his mobile phone with someone. After some time, a man arrives in the middle of the night with news about a terrorist attack in Milan.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly ( 1936-1959 ) is a tour de force for biopics of rock 'n' roll stars -- a masterwork of pop culture who was the subject of two films and several books. Written and directed by director Richard Maltby and starring Johnny Depp as Buddy, the film presents Buddy as a musician in love with the world's most famous guitar -- a Gibson Les Paul copy. Depp turns in an exceptional performance as Buddy Holly, playing both his own music and songs by such great rock artists as Jerry Lee Lewis, Johnnie Ray, Bo Diddley, and others.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar! The film took a while to pick up from the start, at least for me seeing as I expected this was a run-along America Pie flick. But it was slightly different-- a fun-loving slacker who finishes high school and makes his OWN college, running it accordingly. As you can expect, there's a lot of parties and hot girls in bikinis but this film tried harder than your average teen flick. Bartleby Gaines (Justin Long) encourages his students / peers to learn through freedom of expression and ultimately 'shove it to the system.'

This is a brilliant film. The story starts off in Romania,where Billy Crystal stars as an agent who can talk anybody into doing anything. There is a really funny scene here, where Crystal is a child, and talks his father, who is a rabbi into eating pork (you filmophiles may know that this is a parody of Crystal's religion). He is mainly a talent scout, and he's trying to find a suitable villain for his latest movie. After finding out that the whole film has a terrible crew, he accidently falls into a small river.

This version of `` The Lost Horizon '' is actually not a bad film at all . I think the director had good instincts and was trying to explore his themes with an intelligent screenplay . It was one of my personal favorites , and I thought I'd share my thoughts on it . . . The Lost Horizon (1946) "It's an extraordinary film noir with an excellent screenplay by Edward Dmytryk . It was one of the few movies made during the pre-Code period that had a strong moral undercurrent . . . It was based on a Robert E. Howard pulp story .

I never thought I'd say this about a biopic, but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (especially concerning Kenji Miyazawa's emotions) and too little on the literal occurrences in his life--by the end, I'm not sure if he dies (he's supposed to), or if his sister finally dies (she's supposed to), or if the director spent a little too much time on the Galactic Railroad (that's an inside joke, in case you missed it--Miyazawa wrote a children's book called Night on the Galactic Railroad).

Accepted is one of the best teenage comedies I have seen in a long time. It has an original script, talented cast and it delivers an hour and a half of pure unadulterated fun.It tells the story of a high school graduate Bartleby "B" Gains (Justin Long) who is not accepted in any of the collages he applied to, so to avoid his parents' disappointment he creates a fictional collage. In the attempt to fool his parents completely he creates a fake website and turns an old psychiatric hospital into a school.

The very few reviews I could find online of Barnens ö really do not do it justice . I read through them and can't see anything that didn't thrill me. I have been to Barnens ö three times , twice with the family and once with my mother in law , and have been a fan ever since. I'm sure there's more to come . The first night we had a wonderful time . The food is superb and the service as good as anyone can ask. We are now going to visit them once a year for Christmas .

The writers of lost have outdone themselves . Season two 's finale is even more heartbreaking and intense than the last episode. Every Lost fan is going to be crying during tonight's finale episode. But I'm not crying. I haven't. I haven't yet. I've watched it twice at home. But when I saw Lost's finale last week, I cried. I watched Lost with my mom because she'd been watching it while I was at school and now she doesn't have much of an excuse. Not that I didn't have much of one.

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from ! For some reason I have never seen it. But I have seen a few more films, one of them by the same director that is on my list. I just don't know when I'm going to see them. It looks like they don't want to let this go by without a review, so go for it, they can't be as bad as they are getting a lot of flack. It's a good movie, I liked it.

Indeed , Cynthia Watros is in this movie as Elizabeth talking to Desmond . Though I 'm just wondering how this was possible . After watching the trailer of the movie , I was shocked to see that Desmond was actually playing himself and Elizabeth was really playing the role of him . But that was just my personal experience of watching it . I 'm sorry but this is still one of the best movie I have watched in my life and I hope I get to have the privilege to watch the sequel . But if you haven 't seen the original movie , go watch it , because it really is fantastic .

Mark Blankfield played Jekyll and Hyde.Michael McGuire was the dad.Tim Thomerson was the plastic surgeon.Did you even see this movie? No? Well, then, let’s move on and tell you all about it. And we’re not talking about the plot here, we’re talking the characters. It was just a movie, right? Yeah, but let’s take it from the beginning and just talk about them. Let’s talk about them in all their glory. Let’s start with Tim Thomerson.

I always liked this movie, I have seen it so many times but I always enjoyed it :) the story is interesting and special. But the only thing I have to disagree with is that I don't think Max lived in a Romanian monastery or what was that :P They don't look that way in Romania.. Anyway, back to the story, Ghita Muresan played pretty well but as someone said before me, his English needs to improve. And there were some funny moments and some tragical/sad parts too. It worths being seen, I thought it was sweet that the giant wanted to find his love.

Ah the Outer Limits. I love that show. It was surpremely creepy, or down-right mysterious. I loved all the genres of the show, from horror, to thriller to mystery, whatever the genre, it was good. I guess I must have started watching way after it got canceled, when Sci-fi showed it as re-runs, or played marathons of it. It was a really good show, I don't know all about the seasons and everything but I do remember that every time I saw the screen freak out and the voice on the TV say: "There is nothing wrong with your television.

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old, I adore AristoCats. It is a movie that contains no double-entendres, no almost-swear words like heck or darn, no parents who are functional idiots, and no crotch-smashing or flatulence jokes that are so prevalent in even the "best" kids movies these days. The story line is sweet and interesting. The music is great. The love story is quite romantic. The kittens are adorable, and the various other characters are unique and attention-capturing. The action is simple and not overwhelming or confusing.

I really enjoyed this film, it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat. It was very well directed. I think it was important that they showed the other couple's life as well as Terry and Bobbys and show them as people with emotions. As this film needed to show Bobby as a cold and vindictive person.I agree with another review it was sick love, not true love. He didn't need to go to great lengths as murder to give his wife a baby. He should have been honest with her and told her that he was sterile and decide to adopt a baby together.

Made at the height of the Black Power movement , this movie portrays African-American Putney Swope ( Arnold Johnson ) as a hero, who becomes a major force in the world of jazz music. In the 1950's the jazz scene in the United States was dominated by white musicians, who had a huge market of record buyers for their music. For some reason, this market had no competition from African-American musicians of the era. In other words, white jazz musicians had the upper hand. This led to racism and exclusion, with black musicians playing second fiddle.

This is one of my favourite Disney films. It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation: cute animals, great songs, a nasty villain and lots of adventure. The story begins in Paris, where aristocat Duchess and her three kittens live with their Mistress in a mansion. Life is perfect for them until the Mistress' fiendish butler Edgar discovers that she plans to leave her entire fortune to the cats. He realises that if he even stands a chance of claiming the fortune, the cats will be out of the way.

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh: as the Monkees reduce their entire career to a one-minute TV commercial about dandruff! See: the 50 foot Victor Mature try to figure out what the heck he's doing in this film! Hear: Frank Zappa (with his pet cow on leash) tell Davey Jones "Your music is awfully white"! Experience: the Monkees' only live performance as a real rock band play the honest-to-gosh first-ever real punk-rock song (Circle Sky)! Listen: as Davey Jones sings a Harry Nielsen song about having a transsexual father!

The "old dark house" sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the oldies to-day. Here is one that provides so very many suspicious characters you have to wonder how they will be able to tie up all the loose ends in the 6 reel running time.The Crooked Circle is a gang of counterfeiters and thieves who have decided to take revenge on Col. Walters (Berton Churchill) who has sent one of their ranks to prison. They decide he must die that very night. Meanwhile the Colonel's own group, The Sphinx Club, is determined to protect him at all costs.

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time . Top 20 is the best movie on here I have seen in a long long time and its the best movie I've ever seen in my whole life . It's very interesting as well . It makes me realize that I really have been living a life I shouldn't have lived . It really made me realize how stupid I've been . It really made me realize my self worth again . This movie truly is one of the best movies I've ever seen .

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode , THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best episode yet . it is an excellent episode and probably the best since " THE MASSACRE OF THE FEMALE REPUBLIC " . I think that episode had its moments , but it definitely had its weak points as well . the episode starts off in an odd manner in that our heroes get a tip that their target might be on a cruise ship somewhere in the pacific ocean . the only thing is that there is no such ship .

I 'm not sure why this film is averaging so low on IMDb when it 's absolutely everything you could want from a horror flick. Sure, there are some moments that are quite predictable, but the overall story is really good, making it easy to overlook the few flaws in the script. If you are looking for an entertaining horror flick for the whole family, then this is the one that will do the job! The story is really simple. A few friends decide to have a get together at their lake house. They go to bed and are awoken to a screaming from the other room.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon. I loved the film so much as well as the songs that I went several times to the cinema to see it again and again. My mother bought the LP and I learnt the songs off by heart, just as I did with "The sound of Music" (which people hardly know in Austria). I think the problem with some of these self-appointed critics who's comments get published is that they don't have a romantic soul and didn't see the film through the eyes of a young teenager.

I saw this film at the Seattle International Film Festival in a full house of avid movie buffs and Indian cinema aficionados (from Mumbai). In the movie, a young girl, Ritu is forced to move to her new city to escape her evil step-mother. While her step-mother is on a trip abroad, Ritu is left in her place with only a father and a little brother. While her father is away on business, she is forced to take on the role of housekeeper for the wealthy family that owns her apartment complex.

Without going into any details of a good ... if a somewhat provocative ... TV movie , there seems to be little doubt ... about who is most at the centre of the plot. No other character is so central and so central that we would not forgive them for anything that happens to them, and the story does not spare them, not once, of being involved in anything, either good or bad. There are some moments that are so funny, that one is inclined to ask "how come he didn't die from laughing" but in the end I don't think this is a movie.

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters in the U.K. on Oct. 30, 1961, and has become an extremely popular cult film. The movie is based on a story by Richard Matheson, an author for whom the U.S. government awarded a Pulitzer Prize in 1949, for "The Night They Arrested Charlie Parker," a novel set in Harlem during the 1960s. The story takes place over a period of several months and was based on interviews and a diary kept by Matheson's father.

A mix of 70 's drug humor along with parody of medicine and classic story line . As I 've noticed many of my friends who do this sort of thing are not a big fan of most things in life. Some of them take the attitude that because they find something boring then they do it better. I personally have found the opposite is true and if you find something boring I think you should try to make it more interesting in some ways. This was a fun book to read and one that you will never forget.

I absolutely adore this movie! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store. I saw Kathy Bates was in it, so I figured it had to have some worth, you know? I watched it the first time just shaking my head . . . huh? Then it was the last scene and I found myself aching from smiling so hard. I clicked "play movie" and watched the whole thing again. It is without doubt the quirkiest movie I've ever seen. But the more I watch it, the more I love it.

`` Back in the Day '' is an interesting , but flawed effort . Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper, who once worked as a police officer, but who, after retirement, takes it up again after his son, Reggie Jr. , was killed in a drive-by , and his partner is murdered . But when Reggie starts having nightmares about his past, he starts looking into his family background . He learns that he was arrested for murder years earlier , but was never convicted . As he investigates, he finds out about a series of murders connected to a missing girl.

The Aristocats is really quite charming , and is rated far too low on IMDb . The songs are n't all bad , although there is one that I found quite annoying , because she just doesn't care . It is a shame , however , as the show was really good , especially for children and adults alike . I haven't heard the songs, and the show isn't available on DVD, but the Aristocats has been renewed for season 3, so you might be able to catch up on the show in the meantime.

The Buddy Holly Story opens on a shot of a yellow neon moon on the roof of a roller rink. This is the third image in what becomes a sequence of many. It begins with Buddy, wearing a dark suit and sitting on a low stool at the rink with a girl beside him. The girl says: "I love your suit. You're so dapper." "I'm so glad to be seen with you," says Buddy. She smiles and puts her hands in her lap. Then she puts her head on Buddy's knee.

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in! I love watching him!! i was 10 yrs old (1979) when i seen him for the first time.i eagerly await each and everything he'll be acting in. hopefully one day i can see him in person. he's very hypnotic and mysterious and that voice is commanding and strong! he is very attractive, even now at 65 he is absolutely stunning!!!! In my opinion he is the greatest actor iv'e ever seen!

`` Showtime '' is a funny film starring funnymen Robert DeNiro ( Meet the Parents , A Bronx Tale ) and John Goodman as a father and a son, respectively, who get into an epic battle of wills over the woman of their dreams. In ''[[Film/MeetTheFaces The Misfits (TV Movie]]),'' [[Franchise/StarWars The]] ''Film/StarWars'' cast, including Mark Hamill, Anthony Daniels and Peter Mayhew, star as a pair of bounty hunters who must work together in order to stay alive and out of harm's way in a galaxy far far away.

What an incredible story and what a beautiful film! Hat's off to Ben Daniels, Lavinia Currier and the great Honore de Balzac. This captivating film conveys the passion experienced by the characters so effortlessly and yet so powerfully. I watched it mesmerized, almost holding my breath as the story developed towards its inexorable end. This film's execution was almost flawless: simple and pure, it plays with our hearts, guiding us in understanding the strange platonic, absolute thus possessive bond between two creatures not meant to be part of each other's world.

Valeria , an elegant and pretty young lady lives in a world surrounded by the walls of her shyness and loneliness. When her father goes on a trip to Italy, she meets with a mysterious black-haired young man named Eluard . In this new novel , you will see how this young man enters a world of mystery and intrigue. This novel also talks about love, sex, and death. And the story ends with an unusual twist that you have never read about in the history of novels. This is a novel that all the people should read!

If you have n't seen this film , do it . Its a genremix as i 've never seen another like it. This movie is a movie for everyone . It takes us on a ride , with all types of movie goers , from children to elders . And it is fun , for both the adult and the kid . I have seen many movies that are a mixture of genres , but never a whole movie . If you have never seen it , do it . A good movie for people of all age. And if you have never seen it , it is a great movie for you to start watching .

I think this show was right on the money for me. I watched it over the plane but there were parts in the movie that made me control myself from tearing all over the place. The chemistry between Richard gere and Diane lane was very believable (fantastic acting on both parts)! I loved how Diane lane's daughter acted in the show too. She displayed maturity and how she transformed throughout the show was easy to believe as what a teenager could possibly be like in real life. I loved this show from start to end. Definitely recommended for the romantic people out there!

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson's work, and for about as long as I've known his name, I've also looked for this movie. I tried looking for this movie all over California for over four years. this past summer i took a trip to Europe, one of my missions on this trip was to at least see this movie. long story short, I bought it and watched it in France! I was blown away, it completely made my trip and i finally feel content that i have seen Luc Besson's first work.

I still can't describe what to feel when I received this by the fnac site. Such a rare movie, so little spoken and known, is difficult to find, even to fans, but the contrast betwen past and present is devastating: now I hold a DVD of the movie, with the finest quality possible. As I did in Atlantis, the other rare Besson movie I bought by the internet, I saw this one at home, with all the lights of my dvd and tv turned off, and marveled at the experience. I didn't know what to expect.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon . I loved the film but found it hard to get into it and it didn’t make the cut for my top ten of ‘the best musicals ever made’. The story was quite good though, and it did a great job with the music. But I did not find it the most entertaining movie of the year, it was, at the time, just too hard to get into. It’s only now that I realise how much of an impression this movie has made on me.

When "Madame" decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble. The snobbish Butler Edgar who is next in line to inherit decides to get rid of the cats. Thereby the story can begin and the cats can go on an adventure that would otherwise have been impossible. An adventure that lets them meet the charming, but not altogether trustworthy cat O'Malley. He helps them through many dangerous and funny situations until the inevitable happy end.The force of this movie is in its humor and music. Edgar is simply hilarious as the insulted butler who is out to settle the score and of course he himself takes some serious beatings.

What a surprise. A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor' only naughtier. Funny guy Tim Thomerson (who steals the show as Blinkin in Robin Hood-Men In Tights) is downright hilarious as the anal retentive Dr. Jekyll and the sex crazed Hyde. The one scene that is really funny is when Dr. Lanyon (Mark Blankfield) catches Jekyll in bed with his daughter and says: "how dare you take advantage of my innocent daughter." Jekyll replies, "but sir, I'm going ahead with the operation. "Lanyon replies back, "oh.

Anyone who has seen Ali G before , should be well prepared for the full motion picture that is 'Ali G Indahouse'. I am not saying this film is a good one but it is just an entertaining movie with great actors that will please any action and comedy fans. There will be more of these films with Ali G as a lead actor in the future. I hope to see more of his work and I look forward to seeing more films with Ali G on the big screen. The movie " Ali's House " was also well received, and the actors did an exceptional job as well.

What I enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of Corfu, being Greek I adore my country and I liked the flattering director's point of view. Based on a true story during the years when Greece was struggling to stand on her own two feet through war, Nazis and hardship. An Italian soldier and a Greek girl fall in love but the times are hard and they have a lot of sacrifices to make. Nicholas Cage looking great in a uniform gives a passionate account of this unfulfilled (in the beginning) love.

Another enjoyable Warner flick . I really liked John Garfield in this , though I 'm wondering why Cagney was replaced by a character who is so much older and yet looks more like him ! I'm a big fan of The Man Who Fell to Earth, though I have always been a fan of MGM films and never knew it was one of those MGM productions. I thought it was good as long as it had its good bits and had not become too melodrama. I wasn't surprised to see that a lot of it had been done before.
