As with so many modern US films , there has to be a supernatural element to the plot , but , in the case of “In the Name of the Father ,” the “ghost” that appears to our protagonists is something far stranger than anything that might come out of a horror film. In many respects it represents the ultimate horror scenario: an ordinary person (John) who sees and experiences the supernatural. In many other respects it's the ultimate comedy : a woman who sees ghosts becomes a world-famous writer (Sarah).

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n' roll. The young singer/songwriter from Lubbock, Texas left his mark on the template of modern music. Inspired by Elvis Presley, Holly would spend a lot of time fighting the system in order to get his rock-a-billy sound recorded. Before his untimely death, he was mixing lush strings with be-bop rhythms. Holly would take his place with Presley, Chuck Berry, Jerry Lee Lewis and Ricky Nelson as the voices of teenage angst.This easy to watch bio is not without flaws.

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert . A brutal but beautiful journey that explores the darkness that exists inside of us, our fears, our fears and our true self. What is there that we are afraid of, and that we cannot live without? I hope this story will be a wake up call for anyone that has ever been a victim, that has ever been a slave, a slave to fear and it is a journey through the darkest parts of humanity that will teach you the most important truth about who you really are.

I remember this film of old . It 's a great , chilling , atmospheric horror picture about a man haunted by the death of an old friend. It was my first horror movie , i 've only ever seen it twice in the cinema , and i thought i 'd seen it every time it came around. The first time i had seen it was years after i had first experienced the death of a friend. I went back to the cinema and sat the seat that he had sat in front of my first time i had seen it .

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic lines, and it shows why so many Americans are ready to embrace socialism. This film has a good chance to become a landmark event for American history. We all know that socialism and communism in America is dead. But with a film as this one, it will become even more real. And, we will not be able to stop this great film from changing our world and the way we see things around us. This movie should be shown in every church and every school in America.

Is this a good movie ? It 's hard to say -- but in 1953 , for many people , this was a movie they would never forget. I just watched it again -- and it 's a movie that 's hard to forget . It was a very funny and touching movie , and a movie that I still find it hard to describe. I 'm writing this in the early morning after having had a very late night the night before -- and just woke up and sat down to watch this movie again . And I really had to remind myself to write this in the morning.

He did one at Christmas to try and bring back a number one song , and now the terrific Justin Bieber is back to try and get back into the top ten. In this case he's only going to get better, and if he's going to get a number one then he has to work harder than ever before. For me there is no better place to be right now than at No.1. I'm here for the love of it. There's no better way for an artist to go from the bottom to a number one.

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan, where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion. I really admired the story and visual approach. The action is frightening and the mood of loneliness that the film projects is amazing. There is much beauty in the melancholy that surrounds these three misfit heroes. Not just in the desert but in the city too. My best scene was after the boy discovers his friends in the apartment and then rides his skateboard through all the remarkable lights of the city. You really feel for this guy.

Chucky's back...and it's about time! This time, with the help of Jennifer Tilly and a little spell from Voodoo For Dummies. Well, at least with this installment, the camp is back. This was the more gruesome of this series, so far. It has some good twists and some good action scenes. This one was by far, the most fun of the series, and successfully, if unintentionally, bridges the gap between pure horror to horror/comedy. I am looking forward to Seed of Chucky. It'll be a hoot!

This interesting film noir features three very good performances: Sanders, Patrick, and Blackmer. The scenes between Sanders and Patrick are particularly outstanding. Demming, as the detective, is unfortunately not nearly as good. He lacks the intelligence, strength, and cynical world view of a Bogart. Had Humphrey played this part, we could have had a classic.Pace, location (a library), and atmosphere are all good. But there are a few plot holes. Sanders strongly fears Blackmer and the ruthless organization (Nazis) he represents. Yet after mistakenly killing Blackmer, Sanders seems to experience no anxiety or remorse.

I ca n't get this flick off my brain . It 's definitely totally different than anything that 's out right now in the theaters . it is so different because it has a very different style to it and it has very different themes , and it 's definitely a different movie from what's already been done . it 's a very different style and it is very different from anything that 's out now . i think people who don ' t like that movie might be saying , you ' re wrong , it 's very good and it 's a good piece of art .

This movie is truly a classic 80s movie ! A must have in any '80s ' movie collection ! Guns N' Roses are one of the bands of the decade !! This is a true masterpiece by director, Dan Aykroyd . This movie is just a classic and a must see movie . It's a movie that will never be forgotten . It's a movie that is a masterpiece . This is definitely one of the most amazing and beautiful movies ever created . Great music and a great plot . One of my favorite 80's movie . Great soundtrack by Lita Ford and the movie itself is awesome .

Loved today 's show ! ! ! It was a variety and not solely cooking ( which would have been fine if i knew what i was eating ! ) !! It was fun to have a variety of hosts and different things each one brought. I would have to be an excellent cook just to know what all they presented was like, lol. I will try to go back and check them out again but i am already on my way to googling different recipies. I have not tried any yet. I hope it is worth the money to pay.

I saw this movie on PBS the first time. Then I bought the video and watched it countless times. Every time I watch it, I can get something else out of it. It's a real testament to wanting to hold onto a life that was good, but now the world is changing. But you don't have to be older to hold onto the past, even the young characters, like Charlotte don't want things to change. The overall tone and mood is excellent. The cast is outstanding with all-stars like Kathy Bates, Beau Bridges and Arthur Kennedy.

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title. The movie was cool,despite the fact, I hate new ones! All of the cast was awesome . It has great cast and an awesome plot!! The main plot is a man is poisoned and he has to solve his own murder , neat eh? !Dennis Quaid is the man who is "D.O.A"(in other words Dead On Arrival).He finds help with his friends, but everyone is now a suspect! !Dennis's character has several hours to find out who poisoned him.

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life, the action was great, and i was so scared, there was a lot of gore WHICH MADE It GREAT, i would see it 1,000 more times, and Paris Hilton, D*MN she fine in that movie. But anyway, i would recommend it to anybody, even kids(like me) Adults like it to. You would probably have nightmares at night though, but beside that, IT IS AWESOMe, I CANT STOP BRAGGING ABOUT IT.

When the Romulans come, they will not be bearing gifts; no, they bring with them war - war and conquest. As any familiar with this episode know, it is a redux of the war film "The Enemy Below" from the fifties. The obvious difference is that instead of a battleship and a submarine (or an American Destroyer & German U-boat) engaged in lethal war games, it is two starships in outer space. In Trek history, about 100 years before the events here, according to this episode, Earth fought the Romulan Wars.

Easily Lucio Fulci's most respected film, "Don't Torture a Duckling" is highly renowned for it's edgy subject matter, gruesome imagery, and strong storyline. Terror befalls a small Italian village as young boys begin turning up murdered, engulfing the confused and determined authorities plus a dedicated detective in mystery. Was it the creepy hermit? The spastic voodoo witch? One of the hookers? The rich girl? Someone else? Contrary to most fan's frequent representation on the film's violent content - I consider it much more plot driven; featuring only one real moment of memorable bloodshed (involving chains and boards).

I didn't know what to expect when I rented this widescreen DVD. I knew it had a cult following but I had also seen a lot of the director's later works which although delightfully gory were also pretty much incoherent. DON'T TORTURE A DUCKLING actually had a linear storyline and a mystery that kept me guessing almost until the end. And after all was said and done, it was a genuinely unsettling and creepy experience. One major caveat: I would much rather have heard the original soundtrack and read English subtitles than the uneven dubbing found here.

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title . The movie was cool , despite the fact that i thought the story was just a joke . But after seeing this , i don't know if the movie was a joke or not . Because the story is just plain funny . And the ending was too funny . The way the plot was going , it's like you can't take your eyes off the screen for a minute . It's like being on an amazing roller coaster ride , and you can't wait for the final descent to come .

This Oscar-winning short film ( 40 minutes ) , based on a short story by William Faulkner , takes us on a journey across the American West . It tells the story of two men, one white and one black, both on the run, on the run from their own past and from the law . The film's director, Robert Bresson, was one of the founding directors of the Cinémathèque Française. He directed this film as an homage to William Faulkner, the great writer who had written a series of eight novels of the West in which he set out his vision of American society.

I first saw `` Signs of Life '' on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation . It 's a wonderfully funny play. The author, George S. Kaufman, was born in Brooklyn in 1909. His first plays appeared in his teens. His first big success was '' The Dark Hand '' (1933), and then he got the break of writing for a Broadway play, '' The Manchurian Candidate '' (1962) . In all he wrote 12 Broadway and 15 television plays . He also wrote the screenplay for the 1962 movie version of '' The Manchurian Candidate . ''

Louis Khan was one of the most influential architects of our time, and this film speaks volumes about how little everyone really knew. His son's desire to find out who, and more importantly what he was is moving, and emotional.This film captures the spirit of what architecture is really about, what good design is, and the emotional price that is paid for it. Equally haunting is the sound track. If you see the film, and then listen to the sound track you can revisit the film simply by listening.

I loved this film , which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival . In March 2005 I spent two days and a night in the hospital after being run over by a garbage truck. I am lucky to have survived. This film is well worth watching , although I would suggest you see it with the sound on. It is a story of a man who survived an accident and of his life in the years following . The title of this movie refers to him being the man in the garbage truck.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I've ever seen. Not only it's the mother of coincidence, but also every time that you think you can set up the whole puzzle in your head, the story takes a completely new direction.Take this casualty for example, The US marine, whom gives Sayid the way to become a Torturer, Is Clancy Brown, playing a character named Joe Inman. In the last episode, he is playing Kelvin Inman, the Desmond partner in the Hatch. Destiny, uh?

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history, someone had to be the first. One could make a case that in Shoulder Arms, Charlie Chaplin invented the genre.Hard to believe that back then this was a daring move. When you consider that some of the best films involving such people as Bob Hope, Abbott&Costello, Laurel&Hardy involved military service and made during war time, it's just something you accept and laugh at.In the First World War Chaplin along with fellow stars Douglas Fairbanks and Mary Pickford went out on bond tours.
